name: Dental digital scanner guide surgery
medical_dictionary: Guided surgery is the technique of computer aid for the placement of dental implants. It is a novel treatment that allows the dentist to simulate the operation before carrying it out. Professional scans the jaw of the individual, enters the data into the computer and get a three-dimensional image of the jaw that lets you play, virtually and with utmost precision, where to place the implant. In addition, the dentist can create a guide with information on the operation to drill the gum without having to open it, which will help you avoid any major damage and seize the bone structure available, without having to resort to grafting. The advantage is that the guided surgery is minimally invasive and reduces the operation time and recovery. Sometimes, it is even possible to design the prosthesis from the scan, so it can be placed in the same operation that implants.

name: Mediastinal cancer
medical_dictionary: Mediastinal tumors

name: Infectious diseases (tuberculosis)
medical_dictionary: Infectious diseases (tuberculosis)

name: Lung Cancer
medical_dictionary: Lung cancer is the progressive growth of malignant cells in this vital organ, causing problems in other lung structures, such as the bronchi. It is diagnosed in a very high percentage among the smoking population and almost always to present an excess of cough, which may be associated with coughing. The presence of a primary tumor can be characterized by dyspnea or shortness of breath, hemoptysis or bloody sputum, and other less common symptoms, such as chest pain, ringing in the side of the chest, and weight loss hoarseness. There are, however, other conditions that could suggest the spread of the cancer to other organs (metastasis). The diagnostic examination is to conduct a series of tests such as chest X-ray, CT (scan) of the chest and abdomen, respiratory function tests (spirometry), blood tests, and some form of biopsy (bronchoscopy, CT-guided percutaneous puncture, VATS, and toratocomía). The treatment to be applied depend on the stage of the cancer extension and the type and size of the tumor is found. According to each case, the treatment will be surgery to remove the tumor, chemotherapy or radiotherapy, or a combination of all.

name: Pectus Excavatum
medical_dictionary: Pectus excavatum or pectus excavatum deformity is an abnormal rib cage that gives the chest a sunken throughout the area of the sternum appearance. This deformity is congenital and usually occurs during pregnancy. If this collapse is severe, the patient may experience problems with the heart and lungs, causing difficulties during exercise.

name: Judicial Evaluation
medical_dictionary: The medical report is a detailed report of damage suffered

name: Mastalgia
medical_dictionary: Mastalgia is breast pain is when an increase in breast tenderness to touch or pressure or occurs when a spontaneous pain that is unusual occurs. The causes of breast pain include: premenstrual tension of the breasts, pregnancy, puberty, lactation and premenopausal.

name: Bipolar Disorder
medical_dictionary: Bipolar disorder is a mood disorder in which you go from joy to sadness quickly and unpredictably. It is manifested in states of mania and, in severe cases, depression. The treatment of bipolar disorder begins with the awareness of the problem and the knowledge of the same by the affected and their families through psychological therapies. There is also drug treatment, especially during phases of imbalance, where it is recommended to take benzodiazepines, antipsychotics and mood stabilizers. If the patient requires it, you can ingest antidepressants.

name: Kidney cancer
medical_dictionary: Kidney cancer is a malignant tumor that involves the uncontrolled spread of cancer cells in the renal tubules. It is a disorder that affects mainly to adults over age 50 and men generally. The most common risk factors include smoking, hemodialysis and other genetic reasons (the exact causes are unknown). Symptoms of a kidney tumor usually the appearance of blood in the urine, pain in the lumbar area (near the diseased kidney), weight loss and abdominal weight gain. However, the majority of renal tumors are asymptomatic and tend to randomly detected from an x-ray test done for other reasons. It is a cancer that is detected early can be cured, and that because humans can live with one kidney, you can proceed to the removal of the malignant tumor organ to stop. But, when it is detected metastases (tumor spread to other organs) other specific treatments should be made to halt the spread of cancer cells.

name: Fibromyalgia
medical_dictionary: Fibromyalgia is a chronic disease that causes pain throughout the body and tenderness in joints, muscles, tendons and other soft tissues. The origin of this disease is unknown, but may trigger their appearance several factors including a physical or emotional trauma, bacterial or viral infection or concurrent disease such as rheumatoid arthritis. As in polimiosiotis or idiopathic inflammatory myopathy, fibriomalgia generates fatigue and muscle pain throughout the body, in addition to sleep and depression in general disorder. The treatment of this disease is intended to relieve pain and combat the sleep disorder with medication and relaxation techniques. It is also recommended moderate physical exercise to keep muscles active and triggers for depression is advisable to follow a psychological treatment.

name: Glomerulonephritis
medical_dictionary: It is a disease that causes inflammation of the glomeruli, or kidney ducts that carry out the functions of waste substances. This ducts are called glomeruli and, upon inflation, kidney normal operation is prevented.

name: Gastric Band
medical_dictionary: The adjustable gastric band is a silicone ring that is placed around the upper stomach to limit capacity. It is therefore a type of restrictive barátirca surgery. With this transaction the limited amount of food and the speed with which they pass into the stomach, thus ensures that the patient can sate before and lose weight. It is a simple operation that is performed laparoscopically and is reversible. In these cases, in which must be removed gastric band, stomach generally returns to its natural form. Patients who undergo this procedure should have a BMI between 35 and 40 and commit to change their dietary habits and lifestyle to promote treatment success.

name: Acidosis
medical_dictionary: It is a disease that occurs when there is too much acid in the body fluids. Respiratory acidosis occurs when there is too much carbon dioxide (an acid) in the body. This type of acidosis generally occurs when the body is unable to remove enough carbon dioxide from the body through breathing.

name: Kidney stones
medical_dictionary:
Kidney stones or kidney stones are small crystals that form in the kidney. Symptoms appear when the stones down the ureters, the tubes that carry urine to the bladder.

The calculations are solid pieces of variables aspects mainly form at the expense of salts contained in body fluids. When the calculations are formed or accommodated in any area tract or urinary tract it speaks of urolithiasis. More specifically, when formed in the kidney, they called renal or kidney stones, and form due to waste products from the urine. They vary in size from the size of a grain of sand to a stone of considerable proportions. Moreover, in most cases, kidney stones leave the body without medical intervention, but can also remain in the kidney or urinary tract scroll through and get stuck, blocking the urinary tract and causing great pain. As for treatment, they are usually given painkillers, but has caused a blockage, it is necessary to resort to surgery.

name: Renal artery embolism
medical_dictionary: The renal artery embolism is a severe blockage of the artery that carries blood to the kidney. A slight blockage can affect kidney function and if the obstruction is total can generate permanent kidney failure.

name: Atherosclerotic Renal Disease
medical_dictionary: It occurs when cholesterol and fat deposits are concentrated in the blood vessels of the kidneys. These deposits form the so-called plaques, which can reduce blood flow to tissues and cause swelling. It is a disease with very townhalls artoesclerosisi, and the risk factors are the same age, male sex, smoking, hypertension and diabetes.

name: Renal artery stenosis
medical_dictionary: It is the narrowing of the kidney arteries, which can cause hypertension and, occasionally, to reduce the role and size of the kidneys.

name: Hypercholesterolemia
medical_dictionary: Hypercholesterolemia is the presence of blood cholesterol above normal levels. This increase is often associated with heart problems, diet, sex, lifestyle and endogenous synthesis. Thus the concentration of blood cholesterol hereditary and dietary factors involved, along with other related physical activity. We can distinguish two types of hypercholesterolemia. Primary, derived from problems with cholesterol transporters systems and genetic factors, and the secondary, where the increase in cholesterol is associated with certain liver, endocrine and kidney disease.

name: Kidney injury
medical_dictionary: Renal injury is damage to the kidneys by a problem in the blood vessels, can be an aneurysm, an obstruction, trauma, etc.

name: Urinary Tract Infection
medical_dictionary:
The urinary tract infection or urinary tract can occur in different parts of the same:

  • Cystitis is when infection occurs in the bladder.
  • Pyelonephritis is when it occurs in the kidneys
  • Urethritis if infection occurs in the urethra, the tube that carries urine from the bladder out

The vast majority of infections are caused by bacteria. They are more likely in women because their urethra is shorter and is closer to the anus.

name: Nephroblastoma
medical_dictionary: Wilms tumor, also called nephroblastoma, is a malignant tumor of the kidney. It is a type of abdominal cancer very common in children.

name: Kidney Stones
medical_dictionary: The kidney stones are solid pieces which are formed by urine wastes. Their size varies from the size of a grain of sand to a stone of considerable proportions. You can scroll through the urinary tract and get stuck, blocking the urinary tract and causing great pain. As for treatment, they are usually given painkillers, but has caused a blockage, it is necessary to resort to surgery.

name: Polycystic Kidney
medical_dictionary: Polycystic kidney disease is a disorder involving the formation of multiple cysts in the kidneys. These cysts increase the size of the kidney. Is an inherited disease that is transmitted from father to son. Its main symptoms are: abdominal tenderness or pain, blood in urine, excessive urination at night, flank pain, drowsiness, joint pain and nail abnormalities.

name: Protein in the urine (Proteinuria)
medical_dictionary: Proteinuria is the presence of protein in the urine. To diagnose the amount of protein in blood, a test is performed albumin.

name: Hormone
medical_dictionary: Hormone therapy is a type of drug therapy indicated for different diseases. It is used, for example, in treatment of breast cancer or menopausal. Hormone therapy is a treatment used in cancer patients, especially in breast cancer and prostate cancer, and during menopause. This method aims to prevent stimulus generated hormone on growth of tumor cells, by blocking receptor or reducing hormone production. The main methods of treatment are hormonal ablative hormonotherapy, consisting surgical or radiotherapy gonads approach to reducing levels of circulating hormones, and pharmacological hormonterapia. The latter based on drug delivery to prevent the growth of tumor cells.

name: Traumatic brain injury
medical_dictionary: Head injury are brain injury caused by external factors, resulting in a decrease or alteration of the training of the physical, cognitive and emotional abilities of the patient. In this type of trauma can produce a surface bulge occur either reach an internal brain injury .

name: Pediatric cerebral palsy
medical_dictionary: Paralysis cerebral describes a group of developmental disorders psychomotor, causing a limitation of the activity of the person, attributed to problems in developing brain of the fetus or child. Psychomotor disorders of cerebral palsy are often accompanied by cognitive, sensory perception and communication issues, and sometimes, behavioral disorders ".

name: Multiple Sclerosis
medical_dictionary: Multiple sclerosis (MS) is a neurodegenerative disease that affects the brain and spinal cord, ie, the central nervous system. The disease affects more women than men and is of unknown cause, although there are several indications related to autoimmune mechanisms damaged. In severe cases, the disease eventually leads to reduced mobility or full disability. The symptoms are varied, may last longer and can affect any part of the body. The most common are fatigue, balance and movement problems, constipation and urinary incontinence, loss of vision, facial pain, slurred speech, and other neurological and sexual difficulties. A cure for multiple sclerosis is still unknown, but there are various treatments to prevent progression of symptoms and maintain quality of life of patients.

name: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis
medical_dictionary: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) is a enfermad of brain neurons and spinal cord that occurs when nerve cells lose their functioning to death. One in ten cases of ALS is caused by a genetic defect. For all other cases still exact cause is unknown.

name: Macular hole
medical_dictionary:
We say that someone has a macular hole when the patient suffers a break in the macula, or na very small part of our eye that is located in the center of the retina. The macula is responsible for central vision and provide allows us to capture the details in order to perform such everyday activities like reading.

Two types of macular holes that affect the function of a partial or full thickness retina way. On the one hand, there are those that affect the entire retina, called lamellar macular holes and, on the other, those affecting our retina partial way, post-traumatic macular holes.

name: Integrative Nutrition
medical_dictionary: Integrative Nutrition aims to provide guidelines customized for each patient nutrition and lifestyles, for complete involvement, which allows you to reach optimal health. This treatment studies the individual as a whole, through different tests to determine your overall health. Then the nutritionist can set these individualized dietary guidelines.

name: Nutritional Coaching
medical_dictionary: Nutritional Coaching is a personalized service to a patient in which the professional establishes a dialogue with him for proper disposal to change. This change, therefore, is to introduce habits, tantao power as life, health, for the patient to achieve an optimal state of health. Professional coaching nutritional uses different tools to achieve this provision by the patient, it costs you to make that change.

name: Migraines
medical_dictionary: Migraine is the most prevalent form of headache characterized by vasospasms. It is a common type of headache that may incur symptoms such as nausea, vomiting and sensibiidad to light. The main symptom is a throbbing pain on one side of the head. Some people also feel a warning sign called aura characterized by causing vision disturbances. Alcohol, stress, anxiety, certain odors, loud noises, bright lights, certain foods and smoking are factors that can trigger a migraine. Although there is no specific treatment, it is key to learn to control tension headaches.

name: Bruxism
medical_dictionary: Bruxism is the action to exert pressure between the teeth and make them slide causing problems in the temporomandibular joint (TMJ) and wear of the surface of the teeth. The main causes of bruxism are stress, body and closing the mouth position, sleeping habits or the patient's ability to relax. Bruxism evaluation should be done with this in count in the field of dentistry and otolaryngology, since it can cause hearing disorders such as ear infections. The goal of treatment is to reduce pain, prevent tooth decay and reduce teeth grinding full. To relieve pain you can apply ice, avoid eating hard foods like nuts, candy or steaks, drink lots of water, sleep and reduce stress. The damage of the teeth, mouth prosthesis often called splints or appliances apply.

name: Brachytherapy
medical_dictionary: Brachytherapy or internal radiation therapy uses a radioactive implant that is placed inside the body or near the tumor. Internal radiation therapy allows a higher dose of radiation to a smaller area.

name: Fractionated stereotactic radiotherapy
medical_dictionary: Fractionated stereotactic radiotherapy (RTEF) is a technique of irradiation. The treatment is done in several sessions, depending on each patient. Radiotherapy Stereotactic radiotherapy is a technique that allows you to manage a large dose of radiation to the affected area. A guide for locating the tumor and organs at risk is employed, adjacent tissues thus receive a lower dose.

name: Ophthalmic Brachytherapy
medical_dictionary: The ophthalmic brachytherapy is a technique that is used to treat ocular tumors.

name: Endovascular Brachytherapy
medical_dictionary: Endovascular brachytherapy is used to prevent the obstruction of a blood vessel. It is used to prevent relapse when it has already made an angioplasty since radiation prevents restenosis.

name: Dialysis
medical_dictionary: Dialysis is renal failure. By a physical separation of materials, you can eliminate those that are harmful or toxic to the blood, a task that normally would a healthy kidney. Do the job of the kidneys when they can not, is very imporant, because the acumulaión of waste can cause even death.

name: Bladder Cancer
medical_dictionary: The bladder is a hollow organ in the lower abdomen whose main function is to store urine before it is expelled from the body. Bladder cancer occurs when cells cancersosas in the inner membrane of this body are formed, and its symptoms are painful urination or lower back, frequent urination and blood in the urine. The main risk factors are smoking and exposure to certain chemicals, along with a family history of the disease. This type of cancer can be limited to the lining of the bladder, and then called surface or spread through the lining of the bladder and even to nearby organs, which are called invasive in this case. Treatment depends on the severity and type of cancer, but may generally include radiation therapy, chemotherapy and / or surgery.

name: Hemodialysis
medical_dictionary: It is a type of dialysis, which cleans out harmful substances in the Sandre when the kidneys are not healthy to do so. During hemodialysis, blood passes through a tube to a fitro, which may be an artificial kidney. Hemodialysis can also help control overall red blood cells and blood presiíon.

name: Renal Biopsy
medical_dictionary: It is the removal of a small piece of kidney tissue that is tested for some types of diseases. Kidney biopsy may be percutaneous, i.e., through the skin; or open, or by surgery in which the doctor operates the patient, and opens to remove the fragment.

name: Nephrocalcinosis
medical_dictionary: When there is excess calcium in the blood or urine may occur lanefrocalcinosis. Calcium deposits are deposited in kidney tissue and is common in premature babies.

name: Droppy eyelid (Ptosis)
medical_dictionary: Ptosis is the fall of the eyelid as a result of relaxation of the muscles that hold it. This is one of the most common eyelid malpositions, and can occur in patients of all ages either muscle weakness as desanclaje the tendon of the muscle. With regard to its causes, there are numerous, from injuries to neurological factors. They all cause difficulty in vision, so it is necessary to surgically intervene in order to repair the tendon or muscle shortening, as the case of that question. Various techniques exist for these interventions will depend on the condition of each patient eye.

name: Ocular hypertension
medical_dictionary:
When the pressure inside the eye is triggered, we say there is an ocular hypertension. In principle anyone can look ocular hypertension. However, people with eye injuries, eye diseases, certain medications, diabetic patients, among others, may be more conducive to development causes hypertension. Most people do not feel any previous symptoms so it is very important to perform eye examinations to prevent any disease.

Ocular hypertension can be treated through medication to reduce eye strain and prevent damage from reaching the optic nerve, glaucoma avoiding -the loss of vision permanently.

name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease - COPD
medical_dictionary:
Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) is one of the most common diseases of the lungs and makes breathing difficult progresiva.Los way of patients with this disease may have chronic bronchitis or emphysema.

COPD is associated directly to snuff. Among the most common symptoms are chronic cough, abundant mucus and frequent episodes of respiratory failure. It is a frequent cause of hospital admission.

name: Anal abscess
medical_dictionary: Anal abscess is an infection of perianal cavities that causes inflammation of the anal canal. The main symptom is an intense and sharp increases anal pain when sitting, defecating and even coughing or sneezing. If the infection is extended in the time the patient may have fever and malaise. There are several causes such as diarrhea, trauma, anal fissures or wounds of skin and mucosa by sex.

name: Anal condyloma
medical_dictionary: Condyloma, or genital wart is a disease that affects the skin area around the anus or genitals. Also called genital warts that appear as small warts grow in size and are spreading to the genital area. They are usually asymptomatic and, therefore, patients do not even know they have it until later. Genital warts are caused by the Human Papilloma Virus (HPV). It is a sexually transmitted disease in 95% of cases, so it is transmitted from person to person by direct contact, although other methods of transmission.

name: Laxatives
medical_dictionary: Laxatives are preparations which cause the elimination of feces or stool. Laxatives are used short-term to relieve symptoms of constipation in patients suffering from heart disease, hemorrhoids or other problems. Laxatives soften the stool, a fact which facilitates the removal of the same. Are in the form of capsules, tablets, liquid and syrup to take by mouth, suppositories are also anally. It takes one to three days of regular use for the drug to take effect, do not abuse laxatives because they can cause serious problems such as intestinal paralysis, pancreatitis or irritable bowel syndrome, among other consequences.

name: Anal itching
medical_dictionary: Pruritus ani or anal itching is a symptom characterized by anal and perianal itching, initially found in the area around the anus, but can spread to the scrotum and vagina. It may be asymptomatic for periods. Predominates at night when the perineal temperature increases, a fact that increases sensitivity to itching. Anal itching can be severe, causing itching and scratching injuries. In extreme cases it can cause insomnia and thus, anxiety and depression. In most cases, no specific cause is even more associated with pruritus ani are poor hygiene or excessive cleaning of the area of ​​the anus and rectum diseases (fissures, fistulas, hemorrhoids ...), infection of certain bacteria or viruses in the gut, as psicolígicas causes anxiety, dermatological and systemic diseases and exist as certain foods and other antibiotics.

name: New born diabetes
medical_dictionary:
Childhood diabetes is a chronic disease, the second most common in children. 90% of children who suffer from type 1 diabetes is suddenly appears from the first weeks of birth but is from 5 when it is most common.

Disease prevention begins with avoiding breastfeeding infant feeding sugar. Children should eat a healthy diet and be physically atividades

name: Repeat Abortion
medical_dictionary: The abortion of repetition is the loss of three or more consecutive pregnancies before 20 weeks of gestation. Each case must be individualized, age of the woman, the circumstances surrounding the lost or anxiety partners should be aspects to consider.

name: Prostate and Renal Cryosurgery
medical_dictionary: Cryosurgery is a minimally invasive treatment that is currently used to treat prostate and renal cancer, in order to avoid undergoing surgery or radiotherapy. Besides being used when patients do not want to be treated by open surgery or radiation therapy, it can also be used as secondary treatment when the above fail. This technique is less invasive because it uses ultrafine needles small size, similar to those used in biopsies, to destroy the tumor. This is an intervention that does not exceed two hours, which does not avoid contact with others affected, which allows a speedy recovery and is usually done with epidural anesthesia. In the case of prostate tumors, it is customary to use cryosurgery in patients who have a high degree of malignancy, and with small prostates. The aim is to freeze the entire prostate to destroy all the cancer detected inside. With regard to kidney tumors, cryosurgery is also used to freeze all cancer contained in said body and can only be applied in small tumors (less than 4 cm).

name: Laser Lithotripsy
medical_dictionary: Lithotripsy is an intervention designed to achieve a bladder stone broken into fragments smaller. Laser lithotripsy is a new technique that allows the fragmentation and removal of stone in a single surgical procedure. Has significant advantages over traditional techniques, such as extracorporeal lithotripsy, because it is less invasive, they can treat all types of calculations and achieved total fragmentation of the calculation in a single session.

name: Diabetic Retinopathy
medical_dictionary: Diabetic retinopathy involves an ocular disorder caused by diabetes, which is caused by damage to blood vessels of the retina. This defect often causes leakage of fluid or blood in the eye, and if the disease progresses important visual disturbances such as blurred vision proliferation occur. The best way to prevent this disorder is to control diabetes (using insulin or other medications), a periodic eye exam (every one to two years), and exercising and maintaining a healthy diet to prevent the occurrence of the diabetes. When the disorder is in an advanced stage it should be treated by applying argon laser of existing lesions in order to prevent loss of vision.

name: Blepharospasm
medical_dictionary: Blepharospasm is an involuntary and repetitive contraction of the orbicularis (circular located around the eye), which causes abnormal movements of the eyelids. This results in various visual disturbances (uncontrollable blinking, forced closing of the eyes, decreased vision), and abnormal movements of neck, head or mouth only disappear during sleep (facial dystonia). It is one of the most common eye diseases caused by side effects of some medications, neurological disorders in the central nervous system or a lack of lubrication of the ocular surface (which causes increased activity of the eyelid to distribute poor tear). Treatment includes eye protection sunglasses, application of lubricating drops and supply of botulinum toxin to prevent the orbicular muscles contract.

name: Homeopathy
medical_dictionary: Homeopathy uses natural medicines to achieve physical and psychological consequence of a change of attitude that causes such profound healing healing. There are diseases which, although presenting physical symptoms are the result of an emotional problem. This is where the psychology involved. Deal with emotional or behavioral symptoms a patient try to discover the problems that are covering.

name: Anemia
medical_dictionary: Anemia is a lack of red blood cells in the blood. It is not a disease itself, it is but a symptom that can be caused by lack of iron or lost due to excessive bleeding, among others.

name: Spinal cord aplasia
medical_dictionary: Aplastic anemia is a quantitative marrow failure. Hematopoietic tissue in the bone marrow disappears, being replaced by fat. This results in a peripheral pancytopenia: anemia, leukopenia and thrombocytopenia.

name: Leukemia
medical_dictionary: Leukemia is a type of cancer affecting the bone marrow and causes an increase of leukocyte. Cancer cells can spread to the blood and lymph nodes; They can also spread to the brain, spinal espinar and other body parts.

name: Multiple Myeloma
medical_dictionary: Multiple myeloma is a cancer that is formed due to the presence of malignant plasma cells. These cells are found in bone marrow.

name: Myelodysplastic syndrome
medical_dictionary: Myelodysplastic syndrome is a group of cancers that affect the blood cells in the bone marrow. Causing immature blood cells found in the bone marrow does not mature or do not become healthy blood cells. risk groups are people who have received prior chemotherapy or radiation therapy to cancer, exposure to heavy metals and exposure to chemicals.

name: Myeloproliferative disorders
medical_dictionary: Myeloproliferative disorders (MPDs) are a blood disorders affecting blood cell production in bone marrow. This group of diseases overproduced some types of cells like red blood cells, platelets and leukocytes. They have no known cause and its symptoms and treatment vary depending on the patient and their health.

name: Macroglobulinemia
medical_dictionary: Macroglobulemia Waldenstrom's is a type of cancer affecting B lymphocytes and is associated with an overproduction of protenías called IgM antibodies. This overproduction makes the blood to become too thick, called hyperviscosity. This causes the blood flow to the small blood vessels is complicated.

name: Hemochromatosis
medical_dictionary: Hemochromatosis is a disease that affects iron metabolism, causing excessive accumulation in the body's organs. It is an inherited disease.

name: Hemophilia
medical_dictionary:
Hemophilia is a disease of the blood and is a bleeding problem. The person who has their blood does not clot properly and bleeds for a long time. There are two types of hemophilia:

  • Hemophilia A person does not have enough factor VIII
  • Hemophilia B: the person does not have enough factor IX

name: Hemoglobinuria
medical_dictionary: Hemoglobinuria is a blood disorder characterized by the presence of hemoglobin in urine. This occurs as a result of intravascular hemolysis.

name: Lymphomas
medical_dictionary: Lymphoma is a type of neoplasm (tumor) that affects lymphocytes. It is also known as hematologic solid tumor, to differentiate it from leukemia. There are two types of lymphoma: Hodgkin lymphoma and non-Hodgkin lymphomas. They are classified according to their cellular origin, evolution, treatment and prognosis.

name: Hodgkin's Disease
medical_dictionary: Hodgkin's disease is a type of lymphoma, a type of cancer that originates in white blood cells.

name: Barrett's Esophagus
medical_dictionary: Barrett's esophagus or Barrett's syndrome is an alteration of the cells of the last portion of the esophagus. It is an injury that may result from exposure to stomach acid or reflux esophagitis. It may be asocaido some risk of cancer, although under control the risk is minimal.

name: Constipation
description: Constipation is called the difficulty to defecate regularly, considering a normal frequency a minimum of three times a week, although it depends on
medical_dictionary: It is called constipation to difficulty defecating regularly considered a normal rate at least three times a week, although it depends on each person. Constipation is a condition that is caused by the lack of regular bowel movement and may be accompanied by pain while evacuated. This is a very common ailment that occurs due to inactivity, lack of fiber consumption, in situations of fatigue and nervousness. To avoid this difficulty, we recommend following a diet rich in fiber, drink plenty of water and exercise regularly. Although you can use laxatives sporadically, you should not abuse them as long-term can cause the opposite effect, and accustom the body to the same and worse.

name: Dacryocystorhinostomies
medical_dictionary: Dacryocystorhinostomy operation is crying or constant watery eye. It is a procedure indicated for patients with blocked tear ducts. During surgery, a new drain line is created with tissue from the patient.

name: Bleeding disorders
medical_dictionary: Coagulation disorders are a group of conditions that cause heavy and prolonged bleeding following injury. People with bleeding disorders bleed longer than normal and some may have spontaneous bleeding into joints, muscles or other body parts. Hemophilia is a bleeding disorder and affects approximately one in 10,000 people.

name: Purpura
medical_dictionary: Purple is a hematologic disease in which the immune system destroys the platelets. It is an inherited disorder that affects more men than women and is more common in children, affecting you to them equally. Some of the symptoms of purple are abnormally heavy periods, bleeding in the skin (often around the chin), proneness to bruising and bleeding nasal or buccal.

name: Pleural effusion
medical_dictionary: Pleural effusion is an accumulation of fluid between the layers of tissue that line the lungs and chest cavity. The body produces pleural fluid in small amounts to lubricate the surfaces of the pleura, the thin tissue that lines the chest cavity and surrounds the lungs. A pleural effusion is an abnormal collection of this fluid. They can be of two types. Transudative pleural effusions are caused by fluid leaking into the pleural space, which is caused by high pressure in the blood vessels or low protein content in the blood. The most common cause is congestive heart failure. Exudative effusions are caused by blocked blood vessels or lymph vessels, inflammation, lung injury and tumors. The goal of treatment is to remove the liquid, it becomes evtiar to accumulate and determine the cause of accumulation. The removal of fluid (thoracentesis) can be performed if there is a lot of this and is causing pressure in the chest, shortness of breath or other breathing problems, such as low oxygen levels. Removing the fluid allows the lung to expand, making breathing easier.

name: Damon System
medical_dictionary: The Damon System is an orthodontic characterized without any binder, allowing freedom of movement of teeth and generating a placement of natural teeth.

name: Fixed prosthesis
medical_dictionary: Fixed dental prostheses are applied with pieces ranging cement or screws on the tooth structure. One of its main advantages is that it need not be removed from the mouth, giving the patient function and aesthetics. They have the size, shape and color of natural teeth. The patient quickly get used to them, they require the same care as natural teeth. Can I be metallo-ceramic or metal-free, zirconium. Besides applied for aesthetic reasons, fixed prostheses are used in order to regain the ability to chew.

name: Removable Prosthetics
medical_dictionary:
Removable dentures are those that the patient can get on and off, especially after meals for proper hygiene herself and her own teeth. They may be single resin or metal with resin, partial or complete.
- Partial dentures lead retainers, usually metal, which prevent movement thereof during mastication, gestures or speech.
- Complete dentures are those in which the patient lost all parts of one or both arches. They are a real challenge, as they have often retention problems, requiring the patient by using adhesive powders or creams. Depending on the remaining support structures, have varying subject. By design, they can be extremely aesthetic, since you can play very naturally a denture itself.

name: Arthroplasty
medical_dictionary: Our joints are continuously exposed to multiple injuries, there arises arthroplasty. Arthroplasty is a surgical procedure that is performed to restore mobility and its ordinary function.

name: Knee Surgery
description_after: This artificial joint is called a prosthesis. The most common reason to perform a knee joint replacement is to relieve the intense pain of arthritis. Small cuts are made to introduce the camera and small surgical instruments inside the knee to perform the procedure.
medical_dictionary: It is a surgery to replace a knee joint with an artificial joint. This artificial joint is called a prosthesis. The most common reason to perform a knee joint replacement is to relieve the intense pain of arthritis. Small cuts are made to introduce the camera and small surgical instruments inside the knee to perform the procedure.

name: Stem Cells
medical_dictionary: Stem cells are found in all multicellular organisms. These cells can divide, and come in different types, each of them specializing in different functions. In adult organisms, stem cells are used to regenerate or repair the tissues of organisms.

name: Cystectomy (bladder removal)
medical_dictionary: Cystectomy is the removal of the vejiga.Si the reason for the operation is bladder cancer, bladder and all the surrounding tissue is removed. If due to a benign disease, only a portion thereof is removed

name: Prostatectomy (prostate removal)
medical_dictionary: La prostatectomia è l’intervento con il quale si rimuove, parzialmente o totalmente, la ghiandola prostatica. Solitamente, la prostatectomia rappresenta il trattamento principale per il tumore alla prostata. L’operazione può venire effettuata con tecniche tradizionali, a cielo aperto, o con tecnica laparoscopica.

name: Nephrectomy (kidney removal)
medical_dictionary: Kidney removal surgery or nephrectomy is to remove all or part of a kidney. This surgery is done in the hospital while you are asleep and pain-free (general anesthesia). The procedure can take 3 hours or more.

name: Prolotherapy
medical_dictionary: Prolotherapy is a method of treatment of joint conditions of most of the body, which is done through the strengthening of ligaments and tendons.

name: Discolysis
medical_dictionary: The discolysis uses ozone for the treatment of herniated disc. It consists of injecting ozone into the injured intervertebral disc.

name: Regenerative Medicine
medical_dictionary: Regenerative Medicine

name: Kinesiology
medical_dictionary: The Kinesitherapy is a treatment that strengthens the muscles to correct the injury damaged organs. Kinesiology is based on the muscles and organs are related directly with the harm they cause weakened muscles. In addition to cure and treat diseases, its main function is to prevent injuries.

name: Orthopaedic manual physiotherapy
medical_dictionary: Orthopedic Manual Physical Therapy is dedicated to the management of neuro-musculoskeletal disorders area. The difference in this type of physical therapy is that it provides a series of techniques that are based on conservative treatment the pain and other symptoms arising from the neuro-musculo-skeletal dysfunction of the spine and extremities. It also has útlimas technologies and conducting screening tests to diagnose the type of injury before performing the prescribed exercises.

name: Respiratory physiotherapy
medical_dictionary: Respiratory Physiotherapy covers the stabilization of respiratory dysfunction. The main aim of this specialty is to improve regional pulmonary ventilation, respiratory muscle function, exercise tolerance and dyspnea. Ultimately achieve a favorable increase in the quality of life of patients. The treatment is based on the drainage of secretions and ventilatory reeducation. Respiratory Therapy does not replace medical treatment, but supplements to increase their effectiveness.

name: Obstetric Physiotherapy
medical_dictionary: Obstetric Physiotherapy or physical therapy for pregnant women is the specialty that deals with preventive and therapeutic aspects of pregnancy, childbirth and postpartum to allow preparation of the body, especially the pelvic floor during the 9 months to the time of delivery. In turn, it aims to rehabilitate injuries and problems that may arise after delivery. The main advantage for pregnant women is that by Obstetric Physiotherapy is achieved jostling learn to control not to hurt the baby and some exercises to reduce pain.

name: Functional bandage
medical_dictionary: The taping is a partial immobilization used in most ligament, tendon and muscle injuries. It is characterized by allowing a degree of mobility versus funcioanl bandages total limit movement also have various side effects (such as skin lesions, joint stiffness, muscle atrophy or increased thrombotic risk). The taping may be of therapeutic or preventive. Such bandages should not be used to treat more serious injuries that required a cast, but if for rehabilitation once the cast is removed.

name: Massage Therapy
medical_dictionary: Massage therapy is a technique in physiotherapy which includes various forms of massage for therapeutic purposes. Massage therapy is used in the diagnosis, treatment and prevention of certain injuries such as muscle constracturas, tendinopathy, sprains, fibrillar breaks, fractures, sports injuries, etc. The treatment is based on improving the blood and lymphatic circulation by stimulating the organs and muscles. Thus toxins are removed and the body relaxes. Within the Masoterapia are different massage techniques (therapeutic, deep transverse, lymphatic drainage, cryo-massage or massage Dicke and others). This technique has benefits for preventing the appearance of cellulite and especially for fast recovery after surgery.

name: Ultrasound therapy
medical_dictionary: The Ultrasound therapy is the application of ultrasound waves to the treatment of diseases and injuries. The Ultrasound therapy either pulsed or continuous applies in inflammatory lesions of muscle and tendon. It is important to note the sonic origin of this therapy, especially in patients with bone weakness ( fracuras or osteoporosis ). The treatment is performed with an ultrasonic therapy equipment that emits ultrasonic waves through a quartz crystal in the emitter head.

name: Thermotherapy
medical_dictionary: Thermotherapy is the application of heat to treat injuries and illnesses. Status improves the thermal injury by agents, that are at different degrees of heat, on the body. The therapist may perform Thermotherapy surface or deep thermotherapy. The surface is one in which the degree of penetration is low either infrared or reflex mechanisms. Is profound biological effects when given to directly heat the deeper tissues. Depending on the kind of thermotherapy, heat can be applied by radiation, conduction or convection. It is particularly suitable for rheumatic and chronic cramping and increasing the elimination of toxins.

name: Magnetic therapy
medical_dictionary: Magnetotherapy is a physiotherapy practice in employing static or permanent magnetic fields on the body. The application is effected by magnets of high or low frequency depending on the type of pathology to be treated. It is especially effective in treating pain conditions resulting from inflammation but can be used to solve a large number of diseases because of their few side effects.

name: Sports Physiotherapy
medical_dictionary: Sport Physiotherapy treats all those pathologies that develop as a result of sports physical activity. It is a specialty that gives solution to this type of injury through massage and hot and cold aplciando that athletes should avoid taking medications that can cause side effects or doping and harm one way or another to the athlete. So a physiotherapist must meet perfection anatomy used alone and safe physical agents (massage, movement, heat, cold... ) as treatment. The most common sports injuries are muscle contracture, overload, bruises and fibrillar breakage. At the time, a physiotherapist may intervene in the rehabilitation after surgical intervention.

name: Transvaginal ultrasound
medical_dictionary: Transvaginal ultrasound is a medical diagnostic technique used to examine the genitals of women, including the uterus, ovaries and cervix. Images are formed by the use of ultrasound, and the physician observes a monitor by moving a probe while going through the area. The transvaginal ultrasound is usually done during pregnancy, when abnormal findings on physical examination (such as fibroid tumors or cysts), when there is abnormal vaginal bleeding and menstrual problems, pelvic pain, certain types of infertility, ectopic pregnancy, etc. Some of the problems that can be observed are the cancer of the uterus, ovaries, vagina, and other pelvic structures, as well as other infections and congenital abnormalities.

name: Vomiting
medical_dictionary: Vomiting involve the expulsion of stomach contents through the esophagus through the mouth. Many vecesm accompanied by nausea (feeling like vomiting) and stomach or abdominal pain. When we talk about not talking about vomiting disease but of manifestations associated with other symptoms such as headache, diarrhea, etc.

name: Children's Plastic Surgery
medical_dictionary: Branch of the specialty that focuses on interventions to children. These have specific diseases that require child experts in plastic surgery. They are responsible, among others, as facial clefts lip and palate, complex syndromes affecting the skull and face, teen moms with chest deformities, complex ptosis.

name: Extracorporeal lithotripsy
medical_dictionary: Extracorporeal Lithotripsy is a medical procedure that uses chocque waves (ESWL) to break up stones in the kidney, vegija or ureter (the tube that carries urine to the bladder). After the process, the tiny pieces of stones pass out of the body through the urine. Extracorporeal shock wave lithotripsy (ie outside the body) shock wave is the most common type of lithotripsy. Often, patients are placed under general anesthesia during the process, which usually lasts between 45 minutes and an hour.

name: Osteoporosis
medical_dictionary: Osteoporosis is a disease affecting bones and is caused by decreased tissue that forms both of the proteins that constitute the matrix and the structure of the mineral salts containing calcium. Following a skeletal demineralization that leaves brittle and susceptible to fractures and microfractures bones occurs. This condition occurs mostly in women, amenorrheic or postmenupáusicas due to decreased estrogen production by the ovaries and other hormonal deficiencies.

name: Morton's neuroma
medical_dictionary: Morton's neuroma or Morton neuritis is a thickening of the interdigital nerve in the space between the third and fourth toes. It occurs as a result of chronic compression. Sometimes it causes intense pain in the front area of ​​the foot, metatarsal level, close to the 2nd or 3rd interdigital space.

name: Placing Port-a-Cath (Cath)
medical_dictionary: The catheter is a tube inserted into a patient's body cavity and used in subministración of drugs or fluids or foods for ejecting body, fluids such as urine. A catheter ranking is based are based on whether external or subcutaneous, below the skin. Among them, there are vascular access devices or intravenous catheters, urinary drainage catheters and chest tubes. The application of a catheter externally is the implementation of one of the ends in a large vein located near the heart, superior vena cava. Moreover, by subcutaneous way catheters are inserted under the skin completely, also standing on a large vein.

name: Colic
medical_dictionary: Colic is a type of abdominal pain that varies in intensity. The cause of colic is increased, sometimes violent, peristalsis of the abdominal hollow viscera. It can be accompanied by nausea, vomiting and diarrhea. In addition, this pain can cause irritability, tension and stress.

name: Liver Cancer
medical_dictionary: Liver cancer is a disease in which the liver cells become abnormal and grow out of control form a cancerous tumor. This type of tumor is called primary liver cancer (malignant hepatoma or hepatocellular carcicoma). In contrast, metastatic liver cancer begins elsewhere and spreads to the liver. The liver is the largest organ in the body. Filters out harmful substances from the blood, digests fats from food and stores the sugar that the body needs for energy. The main risk factors for developing this primary liver cancer are hepatitis and cirrhosis or liver scarring. Treatment options include surgery, radiation, chemotherapy or a liver transplant.

name: Oculoplasty
medical_dictionary: The oculoplastics is responsible for the pathologies and other aesthetic or functional problems affecting the structures surrounding the eye: orbit, eyelids and tear ducts. The solutions are used most frequently are blepharoplasty or eyelid surgery, the application of Botulinum Toxin Type A and other aesthetic medicine treatments. The first aims to eliminate the tired look through the removal of excess skin and fat from the upper and lower eyelids. The second consists of applying micro injections of this toxin as a muscle relaxant to reduce or eliminate wrinkles on the forehead, sides of eyes, crow's feet and frown. This technique is performed in doctor's office and does not require admission.

name: Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR)
medical_dictionary: Magnetic resonance imaging also known by its acronym MRI is a diagnostic test by which body images are obtained. No X-rays and CT or on plain radiographs are used.

name: Intra-lipoterapia
medical_dictionary: The Intralipotherapy is the only treatment capable of removing localized fat permanently without invasive surgical procedures or practices. The treatment is carried out by injection deoxycholic acid based and is used to remove localized areas of fat on thighs, abdomen and arms.

name: Arthrofibrosis
medical_dictionary: Arthrofibrosis is a postoperative complication in reconstructive surgery, its clinical picture being an excessive synthesis of fibrous tissue and collagen affecting joint mobility. It is usually caused by trauma, surgery, infections or prolonged immobilization.

name: Foot and Ankle Surgery
medical_dictionary: Through foot and ankle surgery you can recover the functionality and aesthetics of the feet, avoiding malformations or injuries that prevent walking properly.

name: Family Planning
medical_dictionary: Family planning refers to fertility and contraceptive treatment techniques. This area of ​​medicine to organize the time interval between pregnancies who wish to have.

name: Obesity
medical_dictionary: Obesity is a disease characterized by the presence of an excess of fat mass (fat) in the body and for weight gain, usually due to a disproportionate food intake. This condition is easily diagnosed by assessing the body mass index and overall constitution of the person. The sum of factors that cause this disease, typical of the XXI century, include a sedentary lifestyle, a poor dietary patterns, and genetic and environmental factors. On the other hand, obesity is often aggravated by a number of other associated diseases, such as diabetes, cholesterol, triglycerides and hypertension, in addition to incur certain social rejection and lead to psychological problems. Also among the population suffering from this disease, there is increased risk of cardiovascular events, particularly in patients with abdominal obesity (an indicator of insulin resistance). The treatment of obesity through the monitoring of the recommendations of endocrine and nutritionists, based on a good individualized dietary plan, and changes in daily routines, especially when it comes to exercise. It is also important to establish these guidelines from childhood to avoid the appearance of so-called childhood obesity.

name: Insulin Resistance
medical_dictionary: Insulin resistance or hyperinsulinemia is a metabolic disorder of the body. The liver, muscle and adipose tissue react to the action of insulin, the hormone produced by the pancreas to glucose distribute and maintain blood sugar levels. The pancreas produces more insulin and can lead to diabetes.

name: Thyroid
medical_dictionary:
The thyroid is an endocrine gland that produces hormones. These control the rate at which the body burns calories or heartbeat.

The thyroid gland may suffer various diseases:

  • The thyroid is enlarged
  • Hyperthyroidism: When the gland produces more thyroid hormone than necessary
  • Hypothyroidism occurs when not enough hormone
  • Thyroid cancer
  • Thyroid nodules: lumps in the gland
  • Thyroiditis: swelling of the gland

name: Stress
medical_dictionary: Stress is a state of physical and emotional stress caused in response to a stimulus or pressure, either positive or negative. It is a state of defense, in small doses, helps the body to react and adapt to events. Thus, a normal level of stress is considered healthy and even positive as it helps to encourage people to act to stimuli of daily life. However, when stress is excessive or not adequately controlled, it can cause mental wear, such as irritability and anxiety, and psychosomatic disorders. A psychosomatic disorder is a physiological disease caused by emotional causes, usually by stress. Some of the most common psychosomatic disorders caused by stress are headaches, insomnia, muscle tension, digestive and heart problems, dizziness ...

name: Maxillofacial Surgery
medical_dictionary: The Maxillofacial Surgery is the surgical side of the stomatology and is in charge of the benefits derived from infectious, tumor, traumatic and malformative diseases characteristic of the internationally defined field for the specialty. It also shares benefits in a multidisciplinary way with other surgical specialties.

name: Crohn disease
medical_dictionary: Crohn's disease is a chronic inflammatory disease of the gastrointestinal tract, but can affect any area of ​​the digestive tract from the mouth to the anus. The symptoms vary greatly according the affected area, but the main ones are abdominal pain, diarrhea, fever and weight loss. It can also cause skin lesions, anal abscesses, fissures, joint pain and anal pain. The exact cause of Crohn's disease is still unknown although recent studies point to a problem in the immune system or a bacterial cause. The disease is not contagious, but is genetically-inherited tendency.

name: Deformities
medical_dictionary: Deformity or malformation is a noticeable difference in the way the body or body part, or organ (internal or external) compared to the average body shape of the part in question. 3% of infants worldwide are born with a malformation from very mild to very severe

name: Achondroplasia
medical_dictionary: Achondroplasia is a disorder in which bone growth is the most common cause of dwarfism. Achondroplasia generates a morphological alteration (formation and growth) in bones that causes numerous complications. The main symptoms are arched feet, decreased muscle tone, prominent forehead and a very marked difference in the size of the head relative to the body, among others.

name: Periodontal surgery
medical_dictionary: It is indicated surgery to correct defects of soft gum tissue surrounding the tooth. During this surgery, it may be necessary to gingival grafts, connective subepithelial grafts, graft and membrane combinations ... The success of these treatments also requires a good prior diagnósitco. And, of course, the abandonment of harmful habits such as smoking.

name: Breastfeeding
medical_dictionary: Breastfeeding is the feeding of the newborn with mother's breast milk. WHO and UNICEF have stressed the importance of breastfeeding, essential for the six months baby piles. Also they recommended to continue breastfeeding later, while others are introduced complementary foods until at least two years.

name: Melanoma
medical_dictionary:
Melanoma is a type of skin cancer, the most serious. The first singo melanoma is a change in color, size and shape of a mole. Melanomas usually have a black or blue area. It may appear as a new mole, black abnormal or unsightly.

It is important to prevent and monitor moles time thinking about the "ABCDE"

  • Asymmetry contours are different
  • Ragged edges
  • different colors
  • Diameter, moles enlarged
  • Evolution: any changes in a mole

Surgery is the first treatment of melanoma.

name: Diseases
medical_dictionary: Skin diseases are those that produce inflammation and skin irritation, redness, burning, swelling may appear, etc. These diseases can be caused by infections, hereditary issues or even their cause may be unknown.

name: Hyaluronic Acid
medical_dictionary: The hyaluronic acid is a type of treatment used to cope with aging. This acid increases the volume and hydration of the skin, making it look smoother and radiant.

name: Chronic Cough
medical_dictionary: Chronic cough is one that lasts for more than three weeks without apparent cause and diagnosed from several tests such as provocation of bronchospasm, spirometry, chest CT, etc. Readers are referred to a specialist when cough lasts so long and not wait many years, as this can have a recurring and chronic course

name: Computed Tomography (CT) scan
medical_dictionary: Computed tomography (CT) is a scanner that uses x-radiation for medical imaging, cuts or sections, for diagnostic purposes. The TAC obtains multiple images and rotational movements around the body.

name: Coronary CT
medical_dictionary: Coronary CT is a diagnostic test that helps assess the state of the coronary arteries. It allows you to analyze very small structures but not to treat them. An image of the heart are obtained in 3 dimesiones.

name: Digital radiography
medical_dictionary: Digital radiography is a technique that involves obtaining radiological images scanned into digital format.

name: Densitometry
medical_dictionary: Bone densitometry is a test that is used to medidar the amount of calcium in the bones. It is used for diagnosing bone diseases such as, osteoporosis.

name: Nuclear Medicine
medical_dictionary: Nuclear medicine is a medical specialty in which radiotracers or radiopharmaceuticals are used. It is important for diagnosing and determining the severity of certain diseases.

name: Gammagraphy
medical_dictionary: The scan is a test that studies goiter, parathyroid glands and the study of pulmonary thromboembolism. There are two types: bone scans and thyroid scan.

name: Mammography
medical_dictionary: A mammogram is an X-ray of the breasts. It is used primarily to find mammary tumors. To carry out this test, the person must be naked from the waist up. Breast on a flat Surface, which is where the plate rays X. After the comprehensor, a device pressed firmly against the breast to help flatten out the breast tissue is placed. Mammography is done from various angles.

name: Club foot
medical_dictionary: The clubfoot or clubfoot is a congenital malformation of the foot, it appears distorted or inverted inward and downward. It is the most common congenital disorder and occurs in about 1 out of every thousand children. During pregnancy, the tissues of the tendons are much denser and this causes the same abnormal growth and deformity in the developing fetus. There are theories that speak of a possible genetic predisposition or because of lack of space for the formation of the fetus.

name: OPG
medical_dictionary: Orthopantomography, or panoramic radiography, is a radiology technique used mainly in the area dentomaxilomandibular. It is a widely used technique in dental diagnosis.

name: Genital prolapse
medical_dictionary: Genital prolapse, or uterine prolapse is the descent is the descent of the vaginal walls and the pelvic viscera.

name: Arteriovenous fistula
medical_dictionary:
Arteriovenous fistulas are abnormal connections between arteries and veins, causing a lack of oxygen to the lungs. Normally, blood flows through the arteries and then returns to the heart through the veins, but when there is an arteriovenous fistula, some blood flow passes directly from the artery to the vein. Thus, tissues do not receive enough oxygen without reaching capillary circulation, whereby the affected tissue oxygenation may be poor.


A major cause of this disease is the abnormal development of blood vessels in the lung. Those who suffer from hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia (genetic disorder involving malformation of blood vessels) are more likely to be exposed.

name: Achilles tendon
medical_dictionary: The Achilles tendinitis (Achilles) is the most frequent of ankle tendinitis. This tendon connects the calf muscles (gastrocnemius) to the heel bone. Da pain in the back of the calf to the heel. It is appropriate to use heel download for recovery.

name: Hemorrhoid Surgery
medical_dictionary: Hemorrhoid surgery (piles) is surgery that is done to treat the veins that have been swollen or expanded around the anus. Hemorrhoid surgery is indicated when the patient has itching in the anus, anal bleeding, pain or gore. Piles operation can be carried out using different techniques, the most common is the hemorrhoidectomy, which involves removing hemorrhoids and leave the area sterile gauze to slow the bleeding. Another method is stapled hemorrhoidopexy (also called PTT or Longo method) which involves inserting a mechanical seaming anal rectal excising the excess tissue and, simultaneously, the mucosa with metallic suture points and hemorrhoids are repositioned in his natural position. There is also a surgical procedure to cure hemorrhoids that does not involve the removal of tissue: dearterialization guided transanal hemorrhoidal doppler (THD method), a minimally invasive and virtually painless technique that involves locating, with a Doppler probe and suture the hemorrhoidal artery that carries blood to hemorrhoids. In the same operation, mucosal prolapse has been placed on your site.

name: Magnetoencephalography
medical_dictionary: Magnetoencephalography is a minimally invasive technique to record brain magnetic activity.

name: Anal laser surgery
medical_dictionary: Laser surgery is a surgical procedure that is performed by the beam of any laser to perform necessary and close the incisions. The word laser is Light Amplification by Stimulated Emission of Radiation (which translates as light amplified by the emission of radiation). This type of surgery is increasingly used for their accuracy and because postoperative patient is much faster. It is used in various branches of medicine, including specializing in Coloproctology for diseases of the anal area.

name: Psychosomatic disorders
medical_dictionary: It is known as psychosomatic disorder symptom or discomfort that does not fit with any medical condition and, therefore, it is believed that its origin is psychological.

name: Lung Transplantation
medical_dictionary: Lung transplantation is a surgery done to replace one or both diseased lungs with lungs of a healthy donor. This type of surgery is used as a treatment for lung failure.

name: Evoked Potentials
medical_dictionary: Evoked potentials are non-invasive tests that are conducted to assess neuronal electrical activity through a series of stimuli in order to evaluate the correct functioning of the nervous system.

name: Chest wall tumors surgery
medical_dictionary: Tumors of the chest wall are presented as a package and the most common symptom is usually pain. The most common location is in the ribs. Although we can find tumors in the scapula, sternum or muscle. Surgery is the most effective for tumor treatment parede chest. Surgical treatment depends on the nature of the tumor. In tumors from benign behavior resection of the lesion is usually carried out respecting the surrounding tissues (skin, muscle, rib arches neighbors). In tumors of malignant nature it is fundametnal make an en bloc resection of tissue injury including neighborhood. Sometimes if the tumor removed once the defect remains is large, it is necessary to be reconstructed with a rigid or semi-rigid prosthesis. In the most common cases, it is not uncommon to have to include tumor resection of the lung, thymus, pericardium or other body part or affixed to intrathoracic tumor. Monitoring after surgery is important, especially for the control of relapses.

name: Vasovasostomy
medical_dictionary: Vasovasostomy refers to surgery that is used to reverse a vasectomy and restore fertility to recover the ability to have children. The surgical technique is to rejoin the sealed segments during vasectomy to allow the passage of sperm during sex and pregnancy consent. The main reason to reverse a vasectomy is the desire to have children with a new partner. The operation is complex, so it must be done with a specialist andrologist in microsurgery. The procedure lasts 2 to 4 hours, and discomfort can be extended to 2 or 3 weeks after surgery. May again not have sex until 10 days after surgery.

name: Infant umbilical hernia surgery
medical_dictionary: An inguinal hernia occurs when a portion of an abdominal organ (typically the intestine) goes through a hole in a weak zone that contains the wall and form a bulge under the skin at the groin area

name: Male Infertility
medical_dictionary: Infertility is the inability to father children after a period of 12 months or more keeping unprotected sex. This term should be distinguished from sterility, which is the absolute inability to achieve pregnancy. According to the World Health Organization, infertility affects 15% of couples. In approximately 40% of cases, it is male infertility; in another 40%, the problem comes from the woman, and the remaining 20% either of the two, or unspecified causes. The causes may be varied: genetics, immune, endocrine, toxic, infectious, etc. So both partners must undergo medical tests. Treatment may include techniques such as in vitro fertilization, artificial insemination, transfer of zygotes to the fallopian tubes, intracytoplasmic sperm injection.

name: Tetraparesis
medical_dictionary: The tetraparesia is partially paralyzed after a muscle weakness. Although the multiple sclerosis is a central nervous system disease, tetraparesis is a common symptom of said pathology.

name: Leoporino Lip
medical_dictionary: Cleft lip is a congenital deformation caused by a very specific abnormality in the baby's development by an incomplete formation of the upper lip occurs. Currently, this slot can be operated even in the first year of a baby's life to prevent further complications since in some cases the degree of separation or cut lip can be severe, reaching the nose. Some of the problems that can cause cleft lip is difficulty feeding, dental malformations or delayed speech. Besides, some babies are born with other abnormalities, cleft palate call (or palate), which consists of an incomplete development of the palate, to not be closed leaving an open space between mouth and nose, which as the case may be more or lower amplitude. This anomaly also requires specialized plastic surgery in the first months of a baby's life to troubleshoot speech and functional causes (difficulty eating and breathing, especially), in addition to improving the aesthetics.

name: Osteoporosis diet
medical_dictionary: Osteoporosis is bone loss normally associated with aging, originating from age 40, but is closely linked to other vital periods as menopause in women or certain chronic diseases. Generally, often it produces no symptoms, although the fragility and bone fractures, especially hip and femur is associated, and persistent pain and deformation. To prevent and mitigate these symptoms and the onset of the disease itself, it is advisable to follow a diet for osteoporosis. This food guide is based on the introduction of calcium and vitamin D in adequate doses, which should already followed since childhood, and takes into account an adjustment in healthy habits such as physical exercise and the abandonment of inactivity, consumption alcohol and snuff, or the abuse of drugs such as corticosteroids. The physician should prescribe the form and amounts of foods in this diet custom mode, depending on the medical history of each woman.

name: Body mass index (BMI)
medical_dictionary: The body mass index (BMI) is the relationship established between the size and weight of a person between 18 and 65, and the amount of body fat, to calculate your ideal weight by the formula: weight (kg ) / height (m2). Normally, it is considered ideal BMI to be between 18 and 25 women, and 20 to 25 in men. If the resulting values ​​are not in this range they are classified according to certain standards as underweight, normal weight, overweight (grade I, grade II or pre obesity), obesity (type I, type II obesity, obesity type III, or morbid obesity and type IV or extreme). In this classification all people equally are not covered because, for example, athletes with a lot of muscle have a higher BMI because muscle weight. Therefore, we should study each case in particular and for the elderly or children's formula does not apply. In any case, BMI helps realize weight control.

name: Psychology of adolescence
medical_dictionary: Psychology of adolescence is the specialty responsible for diagnosis, study and treatment of disorders and developmental problems and behavior of young people during puberty (between 14 and 18, approximately). At this time, the boys experience physiological and psychological changes that often cause reactions or behavioral changes considered normal within the common patterns of every teenager. But when changes in behavior and personality are severe and persist over time, can be a symptom of some kind of maladjustment to their own adolescence or more serious disorders transformations. Some of the specific most common psychological disorders are adolescence aggression, substance abuse can cause addiction or dangerous behavior, anorexia or other eating disorders, depressive processes, lack of self-esteem ... By Therefore, early treatment with psychotherapy prevents worsening problems and chronicity.

name: Anxiety
medical_dictionary: There is talk of anxiety disorder when the reaction alert a person to a situation or event promptly stressful is disproportionate, excessive and persistent intensity over time, or when the reaction is triggered in situations that are only perceived as threatening by the person suffering from this disorder. Treatment for anxiety is mainly based on psychotherapy but the duration depends on each patient. The most common anxiety disorders and their symptoms are: generalized anxiety disorder, a permanent state of chronic stress on the subject suffers from excessive worry and nervousness even without apparent cause;the phobic disorder that causes the person an irrational and persistent fear of an object, activity or specific situation, causing their avoidance (eg, fear of flying );anxiety attack, recurrent crises of fear without any direct cause spontaneously, causing extreme anxiety with symptoms like palpitations, feeling of choking, trembling&hellip ;; obsessive-compulsive disorder, which are irrational ideas and actions that the patient can not fail to have or do to avoid suffering anxiety (eg, washing hands frequently with extreme fear of catching something);disorder and post-traumatic stress reactions, acute or post-traumatic stress, characterized by persistent memories, an emotional state of exaggerated surveillance and general reduction of interest in daily activities.

name: Urethra surgery
medical_dictionary: This surgery involves removing the affected area, followed by a reconstruction of the urethra. Results vary depending on the size and location of the stenosis, and the surgeon's experience. In cases of acute urinary retention, you can place a super-pubic catheter as emergency treatment. This allows the bladder to drain through the abdomen. There is currently no drug treatment for the disease. If no other treatment works, it can perform a urinary diversion, called a appendicovesicostomy (Mitrofanoff procedure). This allows you to drain the bladder through the abdominal wall via a catheter.

name: Electroencephalography
medical_dictionary: The EEG is a technique indicated to record the electrical activity of the brain at rest or sleep to increase the effectiveness of it.

name: Electromyography
medical_dictionary: The Electromyography evaluates and records the electrical activity produced by skeletal muscles in our order to detect abnormalities. The test is performed by inserting a needle electrode through the skin into the muscle.

name: Kawasaki disease
medical_dictionary: Kawasaki disease is a type of rare disease that occurs in children. It causes the walls of blood vessels in the body become inflamed. Influence any kind of blood vessel: arteries, veins and capillaries.

name: Lipomas
medical_dictionary: The lipoma is a benign tumor of cells of fat tissue that can occur in any organ of the body but especially commonly found in the subcutaneous layer of the skin. Typically, lipomas grow slowly, they are soft and extraction occurs easily. At first, these lipomas are small, and usually occur in adults, but they can augmentar up more than 6 centimeters.

name: Lingual frenulum
medical_dictionary: The frenulum is a vertical fold of mucosa situated below the tongue and it is a problem when it is shorter than normal, because it limits our movements. Having a short frenulum does not pose many difficulties in speech, but it can cause difficulties in breastfeeding and later can trigger other problems.

name: Congenital torticollis
medical_dictionary: Congenital torticollis is a condition that involves a deformity of the neck muscles, which occurs in newborns or during the first two months. Congenital torticollis is caused by damage to the sternocleidomastoid muscle, which can occur if the baby's head was badly positioned when he was in the womb.

name: Hypospadias
medical_dictionary: Hypospadias is a birth defect in which the urethra is located on the underside of the penis instead of the tip thereof. In addition, patients suffering from a malformation of the foreskin, a curvature of the penis during erection and have to sit to urinate.

name: Dysplasia
medical_dictionary: Hip dysplasia is a defect that occurs in the development thereof in the uterus during pregnancy. Includes changes in the femur or where it fits in the pelvis and can cause developmental problems. Early diagnosis is crucial to achieve a satisfactory evolution of the hip. Could delay early osteoarthritis.

name: Peripheral Arterial Disease
medical_dictionary:
PAD is clogged leg arteries. These narrow and harden (arteriosclerosis) hindering blood flow. It is a common disease that affects mainly men over 50 years.

Risk factors for PAD:

  • High cholesterol
  • Diabetes
  • Heart disease
  • Hypertension
  • Hemodialysis patient
  • Smoking

name: Tearing
medical_dictionary: Tearing or watery eyes is excessive tearing, which is generated when the duct that drains tears into the nose is clogged or malfunctioning. One of the most common causes of tearing is dry eyes. Dryness causes the eyes to produce too many tears and, therefore, excess tearing occurs. Irritation, infection or the growth of eyelashes into the eye may develop watery eyes. Although there are other common causes such as allergies to dust and mold that can cause conjunctivitis or tearing.

name: Pacemaker
medical_dictionary: A pacemaker is an electronic device that generates electrical impulses to the heart. They are designed for people who can not keep up and often beats properly because your natural pacemaker is not working properly. The artificial pacemaker is a cardiac pacing system that controls and monotoriza cardiac electrical activity and causes electrical impulses are triggered. There are two types of pacemakers: temporary and permanent. Permanent pacemaker implantation is done by subcutaneous implantation of the generator, while temporary pacemaker generator is implanted in the patient and can be done transcutaneously or intravenously.

name: radiography
medical_dictionary:
An x-ray is a painless diagnostic technique. The body area to be analyzed is exposed to x, a mild dose of radiation rays, to produce the image.

During shooting image the patient must lie still and remove any metal or jewelry, not to distort the image.

name: Cephalometric
medical_dictionary: Cephalometrics is the measurement of the human skull, which is obtained by an X-ray. It is used mainly in dental diagnoses and treatments.

name: Astigmatism
medical_dictionary: Astigmatism is a defect or imperfection in the eye curvature of the cornea or in the structure of the lens of the eye, characterized by a different eye refraction between two meridians, which prevents sharp focus objects. The cornea acts as a lens through which light passes that is focused on the retina. So that if the surface of the cornea is irregular in its curvature, astigmatism occurs because the light rays are not refracted properly. Low ( 0.25 diopters less than 1 ), medium (1 diopter less than 3 ) and high ( greater than or equal to 3 diopters ): According grades three types are classified.

name: Locomotor system physiotherapy
medical_dictionary: Physiotherapy of the Locomotor aims to correct the alterations that occur in the bones, joints, ligaments, muscles, tendons and nerves. These disorders occur either by trauma in an accident or as a result of normal activity of each person. Regardless of the cause always have pain, changes in posture and movement. The task of physiotherapy is to detect these changes and try to revert to return to its natural state. Most are treated by manual therapy but also specialists can use the active therapy.

name: Pediatric Oncology
medical_dictionary: Pediatric oncology refers to childhood cancer. The most common childhood cancers are leukemias, brain tumors, lymphomas and bone tumors, among others.

name: Fistula
medical_dictionary: It is an abnormal connection between an organ, vessel, or intestine and another structure. L fistula surgery is surgery to remove the path of a channel or abnormal connection between an organ, vessel, or intestine and another structure. Fistula can occur in many parts of the body and is usually the result of injury or surgery. There are different types of fistulas (blind, complete, incomplete, horseshoe) according to their type and require one kind or another intervention. Fistula operation can be approached with different techniques (cold, electrical or laser scalpel) and may include both fistulotomy (incision in the path of the fistula to the tissues heal from the inside out) as a fistulectomy (removal of the fistula tract) or marsupialization (close the channel forming a bag). In certain cases, you opt to seal the fistula with biological glues or plugs. Furthermore, the placement of special drains (seton) may be necessary, as in the case of an operation of perianal fistula, abscess associated. In certain cases the only existing solution to a fistula may be the ultimate placement of a seton (drainage). Most fistulas respond well to surgical treatment but in some cases perianal fistula surgery can leave sequels such as incontinence.

name: Limbs microsurgery & replantation
medical_dictionary: Microsurgery allows connecting the arteries, veins and nerves, return circulation and, therefore, the life of an amputated part. Revascularization is that reconstruction of the limb incompletely separated but accurate vascular repair.
