By replantation is achieved correct a condition that affects not only their functional ability but also psychological.

name: Liver transplantation
medical_dictionary: Liver transplantation is the replacement of a diseased liver with a healthy liver. Intervention is a laborious process that requires a highly skilled team. One of the key requirements is that the donor organ is completely healthy to properly carry out the operation.

name: Telerehabilitation
medical_dictionary:
The Telerehabilitation is performing rehabilitation exercises remotely via the Internet or other media. It can be divided in two: a first clinical evaluation and subsequent clinical therapy.

The main advantage of the telerehabilitación is that it can act in people who can not travel to a clinic. It is already applied in physiotherapy, occupational therapy, Logopedi and Neuropsychology.

name: Occupational therapy (OT)
medical_dictionary: Occupational therapy is a profession that, through the implementation of activities, addresses health and welfare físico.El goal of this treatment is to empower people so that they can do activities of daily living.

name: Neurorehabilitation
medical_dictionary: Neurorehabilitation comprises a set of therapeutic techniques directed to patients with brain disorders and spinal cord. It is comprehensive neurophysiology tests (electromyogram, EEG), magnetic resonance imaging, biophysics stimulation (ultrasonic, infrared and ultraviolet rays, ozone, radiation) and other nerve conduction studies. Neurological rehabilitation improves quality of life for patients, helping the physical performance, motor skills, posture and balance, personality and socio-professional integration.

name: Acquired brain injury
medical_dictionary: Acquired brain injury refers to injury, usually sudden, brain structures. The main forms of the disease are stroke (CVA) or stroke and traumatic brain injury (TBI). Strokes involve the interruption of blood flow to a region of the brain, causing ischemia and loss of function that is responsible for the affected brain region. TBI is a brain lesions forming a cerebral edema and this results in a loss of consciousness.

name: Bone dysplasia
medical_dictionary: The skeletal dysplasias are a group of diseases related to the low height of the individual due to a disturbance in the formation of bones and cartilage, especially in the extremities and spine. They are among the most frequent causes of stunting, and account for about 5% of genetic diseases of the newborn. There are hundreds of skeletal dysplasias, most of them genetic. The most common form of bone dysplasia is achondroplasia, in which there is a short stature by limb shortening.

name: Postpolio syndrome
medical_dictionary: Post-polio syndrome is a condition that affects people who have had polio. This condition, which occurs years after the patient's recovery from polio., Produces muscle weakness in areas previously affected by the disease of polio.

name: Pelvic Floor Rehabilitation
medical_dictionary: Pelvic floor rehabilitation can be of two types: preventive or therapeutic. Detention in the case of patients with risk factors and therapy for mild dysfunction. These treatments aim that the patient learns to contract the muscles for hypertrophy, increased muscle tone and strength.

name: Vaginismus
medical_dictionary: Vaginismus is a sexual problem in which the muscles around the vagina contract. It is an involuntary spasm makes the vagina closed. In most cases, the causes of vaginismus are psychological (lack of sexual information, fear of pregnancy, traumatic esperiencias). It can also be caused by trauma due to sexual abuse in the past or a history of discomfort with sexual intercourse. Given the variety of factors that cause vaginismus, such as physical and / or psychological treatment it will depend on what the main cause. It either case, it is desirable that the vaginismus treatment both physically and psychologically and therefore should combine sexual Education with pelvic relaxation exercises. Also, vaginal dilation exercises under the direction of a sex therapist recommended.

name: Ulcerative colitis
medical_dictionary: Ulcerative colitis is a disease that causes ulcers in the lining of the rectum and colon.

name: Pulse Control
medical_dictionary: Impulsiveness is quick, unexpected and excessive reaction to any situation.

name: Injuries diagnosis
medical_dictionary: The diagnosis of injury tests are carried out to detect all kinds of muscle injuries, tendons, joints and bones, among others.

name: Sport Physiology
medical_dictionary: Exercise physiology and sports physiology is the study of the proper implementation of physical exercise and sport.

name: Endourology
medical_dictionary: Endourology is the set of techniques used in minimally invasive surgery in urology. Diagnostic, therapeutic, transurethral, ​​percutaneous, endoscopic or imaging maneuvers are some techniques that can be performed in Endourological. This treatment is implemented through the urinary tract.

name: Custom Diets
medical_dictionary: Maintain a balanced diet, exercising and not eating risk factors for our health are the three basic considerations to maintain a good quality of life. The realization of a diet not only depends meals to consume, but also performance and tolerance to foods that our bodies need. In a personalized diet proper nutrition are enhanced, the practice of physical exercise considering our daily activities and responsibilities. In addition, it also takes into account pathologies like diabetes, cholesterol and pathologies of stress, among others.

name: Second medical opinion
medical_dictionary: The second opinion is the medical report containing the diagnostic or therapeutic proposal from the illness of a patient by a different professional who established the first diagnosis. Patients may request a second medical opinion are those who want to confirm or know the valuation of another specialist. If the second opinion is different and the patient chooses the latter option, you can receive assistance both in the center normally attending the patient, as in the center where the final diagnosis is made.

name: Checks (Preventive Medicine)
medical_dictionary: A medical checkup is a clinical test that provides information about the state of physical and mental health of the patient.

name: Clinical Hypnosis
medical_dictionary: Clinical Hypnosis is a technique that, through a series of preliminary instructions, it is possible that the patient into a hypnotic state. In this state, the specialist can treat various psychological disorders such as anxiety and stress.

name: Mindfulness Techniques
medical_dictionary: Mindfulness Techniques are indicated mental exercises to reduce stress and combat the many activities that characterize our daily lives. Therefore, this type of meditation is key to alleviating those mental ailments that occupy our minds.

name: Lipotransfer
medical_dictionary: The lipotransference is a technique that involves removing fat from one part of the body and put it in another. It takes place all in one operation. This type of treatment is used to fill or add volume to some areas of the body like the lips, breasts, etc., and avoid the use of synthetic or semi-synthetic materials.

name: Cardiovascular Risk
medical_dictionary: The factors that provide an cardiovascular risk are those who are associated with a greater likelihood of cardiovascular disease such as cholesterol, diabetes, hypertension, smoking, genetic inheritance, stress, obesity and heart rate. These agents affect both the arteries of the heart as the other parts of the body such as the brain, kidney and lower limbs. The most common consequences are myocardial infarction or cardiovascular events such as thrombosis, embolism and cerebral hemorrhage. There are aspects that predispose people to suffer them as age, sex, race and, above all, family history. Also, maintain a balanced diet also prevents the control of blood pressure, cholesterol and blood glucose.

name: Comorbidity
medical_dictionary: The comorbidity or complex chronic diseases is the situation where a patient has multiple diseases usually 3 or more. Simultaneously suffer them all to be chronic and incurable.

name: Family Therapy
medical_dictionary: Psychotherapeutic Focused on the family system in order to address the problems that people present in the context of their relationships with significant people in their lives. The main objectives of family therapy include improved family functioning at different levels, the development of strategies for solving problems in situations of life and above all, increasing mutual understanding and emotional support.

name: Genetic Counseling (hereditary cancer)
medical_dictionary: Cancer is a genetic disease, a consequence of an alteration of the hereditary material, but it is not always hereditary. Most of the mutations involved in the development of cancer are mutations produced in somatic cells. The proportion of cancers with a hereditary component is very small, less than 5%. So far, more than 50 hereditary cancer syndromes have been identified, diseases that predispose people carrying certain mutations to certain cancers.

name: Prosthetic Implants
medical_dictionary: The implant prosthesis are implant prosthesis, that is, prostheses are fastened in dental implants. Implantosoportda to wear a prosthesis, the patient must undergo prior to surgery. This type of prosthesis can be fixed or removable.

name: Dystonia
medical_dictionary: Dystonia is a type of movement disorder that causes involuntary muscle contractions. This disease may well affect or to a muscle or a group of them, can be very painful.

name: Ataxia
medical_dictionary: Ataxia is a loss of coordination resulting from damage to the nervous system that controls movement. It manifests as a lack of muscular control of arms and legs, loss of balance or impaired when walking.

name: Sarcoma
medical_dictionary:
Sarcoma is a malignant tumor in the bone or soft parts of the bodies.
Among the different types of cancer, sarcomas are rare, about 1% of such cancers are diagnosed each year and only 4 or 5 people in a hundred thousand.

name: Liver cyst
medical_dictionary: A hepatic cyst is a cyst on the liver. It may be benign or malignant. Often no symptoms, but discovered in time when a scan is performed in the hígaod otherwise. There are different types of hepatic cysts.

name: Morbid Obesity
medical_dictionary:
Morbid obesity is also known as class III obesity or severe obesity. It is all overweight exceeds a BMI of 40 or even 35 if the patient has a disease or disability to severe as a result of excess weight. In many countries it is a public health problem due to the new eating habits of the society.

Morbid obesity can be treated with a low calorie diet and regular exercise. In extreme cases you can turn to bariatric surgery.

name: Polyps
medical_dictionary:
Polyps are abnormal tissue growths. They can form in different parts of the body:

  • Colon polyps
  • Uterine polyps
  • Nasal polyps
  • Etc.

Polyps are a common problem and most are benign. Although if you have established a relationship between certain polyps to cancer. or

name: Gastric reflux
medical_dictionary: The gastroesophageal reflux occurs when there is an alteration of the barrier between the esophagus and stomach, the gastric contents of the stomach back into the esophagus. Not always considered a pathology as also occurs in healthy people. In these cases it is somewhat sporadic, contact of gastric acid with esophageal mucosa is very short. When altered, gastroesophageal reflux disease occurs.

name: Orthokine
medical_dictionary: It is an autologous therapy, where blood from the patient's own serum, autologous conditioned serum containing a high concentration of growth factors and anti-inflammatory proteins is obtained.

name: Minimally invasive surgery herniated disc
medical_dictionary: The herniated disc occurs when all or part of a disc of the spine is forced to pass through a weakened part of the disc, exerting pressure on nearby nerves or the spinal cord.

name: Genetic studies
medical_dictionary: Genetic testing is a test used to determine whether the patient has a pathogenic gene mutation. If a person is a carrier of a specific pathogenic gene mutation, you have more options of getting the disease. This type of study is done by a blood test. Once the sample is in the laboratory, it is necessary to study the genetic material found within cells

name: Embryology
medical_dictionary: Embryology is a science that studies the prenatal development of organisms.

name: Duel
medical_dictionary: Grief is the emotional process of adaptation that people go through when they lose a family, a job or a relationship. Any loss which were romantically linked.

name: Mental Disorders
medical_dictionary: Mental health has many disorders that are known as mental diseases or disorders, which affect the cognitive and emotional development processes. There are many types of disorders, although more likely are depression, anxiety, phobias, obsessive-compulsive disorder or PTSD. Family background, life experiences or biological factors could be some of the causes that may influence have this type of mental illness.

name: Lingual Orthodontics
medical_dictionary: In lingual orthodontics, the brakets are arranged on the inner side of the teeth in order to align or fix problems on their disposal. It is a form of discreet and comfortable ortondoncia, which has the same effect as conventional orthodontics, which is placed in the traditionally exterana face.

name: Pediatric Neurosurgery
medical_dictionary: Pediatric Neurosurgery is the branch of neurosurgery treating children from birth through adolescence. Interventions are different than those that adult neurosurgeons. The most common diseases are deformities of the head or of the commune, problems and injuries of the brain, spine or nerves or birth injury.

name: Surface Prosthesis
medical_dictionary: The resurfacing are indicated to place in areas such as the hip or knee, and are more suitable for patients under 65 years. Its main feature is that it allows large amount preserve bone, and usually last longer than conventional.

name: Arthroscopy of small joints
medical_dictionary: Arthroscopy is a procedure used to visualize, diagnose and treat joint problems. The procedure only leaves a few small wounds, which heal over the course of the days, despite this, the joint takes several weeks to recover.

name: Shoulder Surgery
medical_dictionary: Shoulder surgery can repair the tissues inside or around your shoulder joint. In the latest surgical techniques, the specialist will use a tiny camera called atroscopio to see inside the shoulder.

name: Hair Graft
medical_dictionary: Capillary graft is a treatment for alopecia. It is a hair transplant from the patient that is done under local anesthesia, the root of the hair of a zone are implanted in areas where there is lack of hair.

name: Microfoam varices
medical_dictionary: Microfoam remove all varices, of any size or anywhere. The treatment is called sclerotherapy. Any patient can undergo this treatment after a scan

name: Adoptions
medical_dictionary: When a child is adopted is subjected to sudden large changes that will change your life quickly. Therefore, some children sometimes require specialists who know how to guide this stage of psychological growth to make it as standardized as possible.

name: Bloated stomach
medical_dictionary: The feeling of having a full stomach of breath, swelling, bloating and about to explode is a very common symptom suffered by much of the population. The increase in the abdominal area may have multiple causes, among which are the accumulation of fluid in the stomach, gases in the intestine by overeating foods rich in fiber and heavy, and air swallowing (a nervous habit), between others. Overeating and very quickly can also cause swelling, and swallowing too much air while eating.

name: Thyroplasty
medical_dictionary: The thyroplasty or laryngeal surgery operation structure is to improve the voice by modifying the cartilage of the larynx.

name: Tropical Diseases
medical_dictionary: Tropical diseases are infectious bacteria that originate in the tropics, especially in areas with hot and humid climates. In areas with temperate climates, infections are lower because of the cold, controlling the insect population and causing their hibernation. The most common carriers of these diseases are mosquitoes and flies, which can carry bacteria or viruses that affect both people and animals.

name: Incapacity
medical_dictionary: Laboral inhability

name: Cervical Cancer and reoperations
medical_dictionary:
Cervical cancer is one that occurs on the surface of the cervix, in the inside of the matrix, the bottom of the womb (uterus). The vast majority of cervical cancers are from the human papillomavirus (HPV). Also, other factors that can affect the appearance of this cancer:

- Not be vaccinated against HPV.

- Engaging in sexual intercourse at an early age.

- Having multiple sexual partners.

- A large number of births.

name: Benign disease of the breast
medical_dictionary: The benign diseases of the breast involve a wide range of clinical situations that can cause pain in the breast, palpable tumor or discharge from the nipple.

name: Malignant pathology of the breast
medical_dictionary: Breast cancer (or breast cancer) arises when cells in the breast start to grow uncontrollably. These cells usually form a tumor that can often be seen on an x-ray or can be felt as a lump (mass or lump). The tumor is malignant (cancer) if the cells can grow by penetrating (invading) the surrounding tissues or spreading (metastasizing) to distant areas of the body. Breast cancer occurs almost exclusively in women, but men can also suffer from it.

name: Conscious sedation
medical_dictionary: Conscious sedation involves applying a sedative, to relax, and an anesthetic to alleviate the pain when the dentist is intervening in the patient's mouth. It is often used for the patient is less tense and that the professional can work better and calmer. The effects of anesthesia do not last long, so the patient can easily return to normal activities.

name: Fever of unknown origin
medical_dictionary: Fever of unknown origin refers to a high temperature long time if a clear motive. The cause of the fever can be caused by infection, by an inflammatory or malignant disease.

name: Raynaud's disease
medical_dictionary: Raynaud's disease is a disorder that affects the blood vessels, especially the fingers and feet. When the person feels cold or stress, it causes a narrowing of the vessels. If this happens, blood is unable to reach the surface of the skin, causing it to fingers can turn white and blue, even after something red. The patient may have a feeling of throbbing or tingling and, in severe cases, can cause sores or tissue death.

name: Child Neuropsychology
medical_dictionary: Child Neuropsychology is a scientific discipline that studies the development of the nervous system in order to find out what happens in the brain of the child for any brain dysfunction related to emotional and cognitive difficulties.

name: Clinical Psychology
medical_dictionary: The objective of Clinical Psychology is studying the diagnosis, treatment and prevention of the aspects that influence the mental health of patients and can generate their suffering.

name: Neurostimulation and Brain Stimulation
medical_dictionary: Neurostimulation works by intercepting pain signals before they reach the brain. For this, a small system is implanted in the body. The system, similar to a heart pacemaker, is used to replace the pain of a different feel. Some people describe the feeling as a gentle massage or in some cases merely the absence of pain.

name: Weight Loss
medical_dictionary: Weight loss is a strategy to reduce the health problems it brings obesity, such as heart problems, among others. Among people who want to lose weight to achieve improved health, nutrition and dietetics helps them to choose food and lifestyle they most agree in each case habits.

name: Cerebral vascular pathology
medical_dictionary: It is a pathologic process that causes blood vessels brain anomaly. It includes disorders or lesions of the permeability of vessels, vessel occlusion due to thrombosis or embolism, rupture of the vessel, increase of viscosity, and other qualitative changes in the blood.

name: Natural Medicine
medical_dictionary: Natural medicine, or naturopathy, is a type of medicine that is based on using in their treatment elements drawn from nature. This medicine can be used in any clinical specialty.

name: Rheumatism
medical_dictionary: Rheumatism or rheumatism or rheumatic disorder also are a set of medical problems affecting the joints, heart, bones, kidneys, skin and lungs.

name: Recurrent Cough
medical_dictionary: Cough causes are sudden spasmodic contraction of the thoracic cavity. This causes a release of air from the lungs, resulting in the characteristic sound we know as the cough. There are various types, from acute to chronic, and can be dry (which draws air only), production (expectoration occurs) or emetic (vomiting occurs).

name: Cancer Pain
medical_dictionary:
Cancer pain can be moderate to severe. It is caused by cancer and its treatments. The intent cancer is treatable.

.

name: Orofacial Pain
medical_dictionary: The orofacial pain is discomfort caused by mouth and face injuries. These impulses are sent to the brain via the trigeminal nerve. The pain may be mucosal, dental or chewing, depending on the source where it is produced. The mucous orofacil pain usually caused by snuff, alcohol or dentures, dental decay originates and chewing, more common in women, is related to bruxism, joint injuries and loss of teeth.

name: Dysarthria
medical_dictionary: Dysarthria is a disorder of the nervous system that affects the articulation of words. The patient has difficulty moving the muscles of the mouth and face, and even some mobility difficulties. Dysarthria after brain injuries often occur.

name: Orthomolecular Nutrition
medical_dictionary: Orthomolecular nutrition is a therapy that is based on providing the body with vitamins, minerals and amino acids that do not provide food. It is important that this technique is supervised by a nutritionist.

name: Diseases of the Pituitary and Hypothalamus
medical_dictionary: The pituitary is the gland that regulates most of biological processes in the body. It is where the hormones that regulate the reproductive organs, glands and other body developmental stages originate. This gland consists of the anterior pituitary gland, which secretes somatotropin filtered and thyrotropin, prolactin, adrenocorticotropic and gonadotropin, and the posterior pituitary gland, which secretes vasopressin and oxytocin. In children, hipopituitarismos are serious diseases, should not administer treatment can have irreversible consequences. Another pathologies that may suffer are pituitary tumors.

name: Melasma
medical_dictionary: Melasma is a skin disorder. It is characterized by spots that appear on the face in sun-exposed areas. This type of disorder can affect anyone.

name: Precocious puberty
medical_dictionary: We talked about early puberty when the body changes physically and sexually develop earlier than normal. Normally, usually it occurs between 8 and 14 years in boys and between 9 and 16 girls. Although the age at which a child passes puberty always depend on family history, nutrition and sex. Currently, there is no specific reason that explains why some patients develop early puberty, but in some cases, is due to brain or genetic alterations.

name: Insteps
medical_dictionary: Orthotics are devices that are inserted into shoes to correct or compensate for the support of the sole. Templates help regulate movement during different phases of gait. They also improve the redistribution of plantar pressures thus preventing excess pressure points.

name: Bariatric Surgery
medical_dictionary: Bariatric surgery is a set of techniques and surgical procedures that help fight obesity and improve the health of the patient. Significantly, it is not a cosmetic surgery and is not without risk, so the doctor must always advise the patient with the best type of treatment.

name: Digestive Diseases
medical_dictionary: Digestive diseases are diseases that affect the digestive system. They can be mild or serious. Some common diseases are cancer, celiac disease, irritable bowel syndrome or food intolerance.

name: Shock waves
medical_dictionary: Shock waves have a therapeutic effect and causing a regeneration of injured or diseased tissues. Shock waves are acoustic waves having high power mechanical and biological effects. Such treatments are primarily used for treatment of diseases which require tissue regeneration.

name: Memory exercises
medical_dictionary: Memory exercises are activities to recover and enhance cognitive functions of patients. The aim is to improve the functionality of the patient in everyday life.

name: Wisdom Teeth
medical_dictionary: Wisdom tooth is the name by which he is commonly known to the third molar. This ridge usually appears between 16 and 25 years old. Wisdom teeth appear at the back of the mouth. There may be up to four chordal, one for each quadrant mouth. Wisdom teeth usually affect other teeth to grow, pushing and causing severe pain. When this occurs we proceed to the extraction of teeth, it is currently the only remedy for toothache.

name: Break supraspinatus tendon
medical_dictionary: The supraspinatus tendon is the top that slides under the acromion and more often suffer injuries. A break can occur as a result of a traumatic episode or develop gradually. Patients whose onset is gradual usually have previous symptoms of tendinitis by impingement. The tendon degeneration with age also causes breakage.

name: SLAP Shoulder
medical_dictionary: It is an injury to a shoulder area known as the Glenoid Labrum or impeller, and the name is an acronym for its acronym in English: S uperior L abrum from A to P osterior nterior (SLAP). This le-Zion was previously difficult to diagnose and treat, because there were no developments as arthroscopy and magnetic resonance imaging.

name: Osteomyelitis
medical_dictionary: Osteomyelitis is an infection of the bone. The main cause is the bacterium Staphylococcus auerus but can also be caused by fungi or microorganisms. The most common symptoms are bone pain, fever, malaise and swelling and redness locar. It is a common infection in children and adults with diabetes or drug problems.

name: Cavus foot
medical_dictionary: He called those arched feet with a height greater than that of a normal foot arch. It is a deformity that can cause the fingers remain stiff or bent inward, foot size is usually lower. It is identified that the base or non-marking of the central part of the plant, or fingers. Shoes show increased wear on the back of the sole. The origin is hereditary in 80% of cases. The most appropriate treatment should be determined by a specialist, it may be with specific exercises or orthotics (insoles).

name: Insomnia
medical_dictionary: Insomnia is the inability to fall asleep or stay asleep. It is one of the most common sleep disorders. Prevents the body recover overnight and as a result can cause daytime insomnolencia, poor concentration and inability to feel active during the day. Insomnia can occur at bedtime at night or in the morning before the hour despetándose.

name: Chronic Fatigue
medical_dictionary: Chronic fatigue is the feeling of extreme tiredness. Also known by the name of myalgic encephalomyelitis. It is a serious neurological disease. The symptoms are daytime fatigue, exhaustion or weakness. In the long run can affect the immune, cardiovascular and endocrine systems.

name: Oxidative stress
medical_dictionary: Oxidative stress is the damage caused oxygen to the body when it is unable to neutralize enough. Releases free oxygen radicals that oxidize the human body, we all have antioxidant defense mechanism against these radicals. When it is not able to fight oxidative stress occurs.

name: Narcolepsy
medical_dictionary: The narcoplepsia is a sleep disorder. It is characterized by excessive daytime sleepiness, disturbed nocturnal sleep and altered manifestations of REM sleep. It also produces hallucinations during the sleep-wake.

name: Charcot foot
medical_dictionary: Charcot foot

name: Craniosynostosis
medical_dictionary: Craniosynostosis is a birth defect in which a premature closure of one or more of the sutures between the bones of the skull of a baby occurs. The skull of an infant is made up of bony plates that are responsible for growth of the skull, but when these plates intersect are generated saturate, causing the head to grow abnormally.

name: Sports Podiatry
medical_dictionary: Sports podiatry treats foot injuries of athletes. It aims to improve the framerate of athletes and prevent injuries of athletes.

name: Memory test
medical_dictionary:
Memory tests evaluate the ability of the short and medium term. They are used to detect a possible loss of memory and its associated disease. Identify the capacity of remembrance is critical to establishing memory exercises that help recuperla.

Sometimes memory loss is a consequence of depression. It may be difficult to differentiate between memory loss and confusion due to this disease.

name: Cognitive stimulation
medical_dictionary: Cognitive stimulation encompasses all activities to stimulate and improve cognitive functioning:memory, language, attention, concentration, reasoning, abstaccion, arithmetic operations and praxis. The aim is to improve or maintain cognitive functioning and reduce dependence on ill. Capabilities that the patient still retain thus avoiding the frustration of working sick.

name: Hemangioma
medical_dictionary: It is a type of birthmark that has a reddish color. Develop at a faster rate than the child himself and with time, its size is reduced and the color becomes more clear rhythm. This is the most common benign tumor of skin. Its cause is often sporadic.

name: Ankle prosthesis
medical_dictionary: It is to replace the diseased joint implant metal, polyethylene and hydroxyapatite. Through a surgical technique of high precision measurement axes, the tibial prosthesis is placed embedded in the bone, which is articulated with the polyethylene surface makes pad to interact with the talar dome formed by another metal prosthesis with hydroxyapatite. These three pieces are mobile ankle joint.

name: Fetal Surgery
medical_dictionary: Fetal surgery is the procedure performed while the fetus is in the womb of the mother. It is rare, only 1 in 1,000 pregnancies requires this type of operation. The fetal surgery can save the life of a baby who has a malformation or disease

name: Hair Treatment
medical_dictionary: The hair treatment is a technique that is used to treat hair loss. There are different types of hair treatments, depending on the needs of each patient and causes.

name: Dementia
medical_dictionary: Dementia is the progressive loss of cognitive functions. It is mainly due to brain damage. This disease causes inability to perform activities of daily living. It mainly affects memory, language (aphasia ), attention, visual skills, praxis and executive functions such as problem solving or inhibition of responses. As the disease progresses you can observe the loss of orientation and identity.

name: Median nerve
medical_dictionary: The median nerve runs down the inside edge of the arm. On his wrist it is between the tendons of the muscles and increased palmar palmaris. The median nerve allows mobility and fine sensitivity rapidly and thumb opposition.

name: Spasticity
medical_dictionary: Spasticity is a disorder of the nervous system that causes muscle stiffness, aglunos even get to keep permanently are made. Spasticity is usually caused by damage to the brain or spinal cord. It usually appears after trauma, multiple sclerosis, cerebral palsy, cerebral hypoxia or stroke, Tay-Sachs disease, some metabolic disorders such as phenylketonuria or adrenoleukodystrophy. The degree of spasticity varies from mild to severe, uncontrollable, painful muscle spasms muscle stiffness.

name: Cholangiocarcinoma
medical_dictionary:
Cholangiocarcinoma or bile duct cancer is a malignant tumor in one of the ducts that carry bile from the liver to the small intestine.
These tumors are usually slow-growing and do not metastasize quickly. However, most are very advanced when detected.
 
The colangiocarciona affects people of both sexes and most patients are over 65 years old. It is, however, a rare disease that only occurs in 2 out of every 100,000 people.

name: Endocrinology
medical_dictionary: estudia el sistema endocrino y las enfermedades provocadas por un funcionamiento inadecuado del mismo. Algunas de las enfermedades de las que se ocupa la endocrinología son la diabetes mellitus provocada por deficiencia de insulina o resistencia a su acción, el hipotiroidismo por déficit en la producción de hormonas tiroideas, el hipertiroidismo por excesiva producción de hormonas tiroideas y la enfermedad de Cushing debida generalmente a excesiva producción de cortisol por las glandulas suprarrenales

name: Amyloidosis
medical_dictionary: Amyloidosis is a disorder in which abnormal proteins build up in organs and tissues and these are diminished their ability to work properly. Its cause is unknown, usually related to excessive production of antibodies by plasma cells. The symptoms always depend on the affected organs. The disease can affect the muscles, tongue, intestines, heart, liver, spleen and kidneys.

name: Antiphospholipid syndrome
medical_dictionary: Antiphospholipid syndrome affects various specialties; It characterized by detrombosis repeat appearance. Anticoagulant treatment after the first episode is advised. In case of recurrent episodes occur some patients may be treated with immunosuppressants.

name: Valvular
medical_dictionary: The valve disease is a typical disease of the heart valves. The valves can be damaged for various reasons, for example infections or aging.

name: Risk Pregnancy
medical_dictionary:
Risk pregnancy is a type of pregnancy in which there is more chance that the mother or the child have any problems. It is necessary rest and medical supervision and, in some cases it is necessary or take medication or an additional food supplement.
To be one, medium, high or very high risk pregnancy, diseases should be given the mother, the fetus or circumstances that can endanger both.
Medium risk
Pregnancies under 17 and over 38, obese women with abnormalities in the pelvis, with negative Rh, smoking ...
High-risk
Severe anemia mother, twin pregnancy, the uterus operated unfavorable obstetrical history or women, infection, gestational diabetes, suspected fetal malformation, morbidly obese, ..
Very high risk
Multiple gestations, uterine malformations, heart disease, diabetes, cervical incontinence, restricted fetal growth, fetal malformation confirmed, placenta previa, severe preeclampsia, preterm labor, ruptured membrane.

name: Prenatal Diagnosis
medical_dictionary:
Prenatal diagnosis is the set of tests to find the right training and development of the fetus. Different techniques are both invasive and noninvasive.

- Test of fetal DNA in maternal blood. From week 10 you can know the risk of Down syndrome or other abnormalities related comorsomas.

- Ultrasound. Several throughout pregnancy are performed. Three months to detect some images of markers comosomopatías and second you can diagnose possible malformations.

- Amniocentesis. Get amniotic fluid surrounding the fetus to detect chromosomal abnormalities.

name: Ear wax plugs
medical_dictionary: Earwax are one of the most common causes of hearing loss. In a small number they are beneficial because they protect the ear, preventing bacteria and other microorganisms can penetrate. Some people, however, produce more wax than the ear can take and is not capable of removing remove, which can lead to symptoms such as pain or ringing in the ears, feeling of being plugged or partial hearing loss. For treatment the aim is to soften the wax, which can be achieved with baby oil, commercial drops, glycerine, water or petrolatum; although we must not wipe too hard or often, as the wax helps keep ears protected.

name: Withdrawal syndrome
medical_dictionary:
The withdrawal syndrome is a set of physical and bodily reactions suffered by a person addicted to a substance when the drug. What Symptoms vary with the substance and time consuming carried.
Withdrawal of snuff affects 85% of smokers who decide to quit. Nicotine is one of the substances that generates greater dependence. Most signs and symptoms of the Snuff Withdrawal Syndrome (TSS) are among the first 7 to 30 days, increases between the first and fourth days later decrease.

name: Drug Addiction
medical_dictionary: Drug addiction is a health problem caused by frequent consumption of addictive substances, drugs. Addiction is a change in lifestyle, both physical and psychological. This is characterized by compulsive and continuous use. Drug abuse includes different types of behavior: the experimental or recreational; Psychoactive to relieve symptoms or drug problems; and consumption in which a dependence develops in the wake of continued use for discomfort or abstinence.

name: Smoking cessation (quitting)
medical_dictionary:
Smoking cessation is a therapy aid smoking cessation According to the attitude of the individual, different treatments may include smoking cessation pills set There are 3 different treatments over the years have proven effective..:

Nicotine replacement therapy in the form of patches or gum.

Bupropion: antidepressant drug that has proven effective for smoking cessation.

Varenicline: drug that blocks the effects of nicotine in the nervous system by decreasing the desire to smoke.

The treatment is administered for 12 weeks, although in some cases can be extended.

name: Nicotine replacement therapy
medical_dictionary: Nicotine replacement therapy for smoking cessation is based on the use of products that deliver low doses of nicotine to prevent withdrawal symptoms but do not contain the toxins found in smoke snuff. It is beneficial for people who smoke more than 15 cigarettes a day therapy. There are different types of products such as nicotine patches, inhalers, gum or Grajeras.

name: Histamine intolerance
medical_dictionary: Histamine is a molecule present in blood, skin and mucous membranes, very important in the defense against external agents. This molecule is also present in food. Histamine is metabolized in the small intestine by the enzyme DAO. If there is a deficit of this enzyme, histamnia not metabolized well, accumulates and causes various symptoms such as itching, urticara, diarrhea or even migraines.   The histamine intolerance is not a true allergy. There is no reaction, the body simply can not catabolize histamine obtained. This is found in red wine, aged cheese, sausages, tomatoes and sauerkraut and, above all, in the tuna. When an affected ingested some of these foods are podruce enteral histaminosis.

name: Breast cancer post-surgery physiotherapy
medical_dictionary: Physiotherapy postoperative breast cancer is all the problems arising from breast cancer surgery. It deals with scar retraction, retraction of fascias, fibrosis, edema and lymphedema, seroma possible, difficulties in the shoulder joint, adaptation of his body schema, fatigue and pain.

name: Burned people physiotherapy
medical_dictionary: Physiotherapy in burned trying to recover areas affected by burns. Treatment should be initiated as soon as the burnt exceed electrolytic disorders. Among the objectives it seeks to hinder and prevent scar contractures using graduated splints;preserve joint mobility and muscle tone;and encourage ambulation.

name: Ectopic Pregnancy
medical_dictionary: Ectopic pregnancy occurs when a fertilized egg implants outside the uterus. It is a serious but rare problem. Symptoms such as abdominal pain, vaginal bleeding, náusas and dizziness. If caught early embryo can be placed by laparoscopic surgery, if the pregnancy has grown too can rupture the fallopian knotweed, it requires immediate surgery.

name: Control of pregnancy
medical_dictionary: Management of pregnancy or prenatal care is necessary for the welfare of the mother and baby. Reviews should be monthly during the first seven months of pregnancy and more frequent as you approach your due date. In each event routine tests are performed to verify the proper conduct of gestation. Some surveys are conducted only in pregnancies of risk.

name: Spontaneous Abortion
medical_dictionary: Abortion spontaneous abortion or miscarriage is the loss of the embryo or fetus from natural causes or not caused intentionally. It is also known as a natural abortion, occurs or before the 20th week of pregnancy first, if later it is premature birth. Spontaneous abortion is divided into early (before 12 weeks) or late (between week 12 and 20).

name: Hipopresiva gymnastics
medical_dictionary: The Hipopresiva gymnastics is based on a series of exercises aimed at postpartum and women with urinary incontinence or pelvic floor problems. They are exercises that are performed at a slow pace to activate muscles and relax some more.

name: Dentures
medical_dictionary:
A dental prosthesis or denture is a device that seeks to replace lost teeth. Thanks to these chewing, swallowing, speech and dental aesthetics is restored. There are two types:
- Fixed dental prostheses: crowns or veneers that are placed over the tooth.
- Removable dental prosthesis: transmit force to the teeth, gums and bone. Require special care and maintenance adaptation. Ation against daily care and cleaning, to prevent further consequences.

name: 4D ultrasound
medical_dictionary: The 4D ultrasound consists in obtaining four-dimensional images per second. This will get to see the baby and moving in real time. Best 4D ultrasounds are obtained between 24 and 30 weeks gestation. Thanks to the proportion of amniotic fluid and intermediate size baby enable optimal viewing.

name: Molluscum contagiosum
medical_dictionary: Molluscum contagiosum is a skin disease caused by a virus that is in the form of papules or small bumps on the skin. It is a very common infection in children, is spread by contact with contaminated objects (clothes, toys,.. ) and usually appear on the face, neck, armpits, arms or hands.

name: Smoking cessation pharmacotherapy
medical_dictionary: Drug treatment for smoking cessation involves the use of drugs that combat dependence snuff, reduce the urge to smoke and withdrawal symptoms. It must be prescribed by a medical professional.

name: Parasomnias
medical_dictionary: Parasomnia is an associated sleep disorder characterized by brief episodes or partial awakening, not a major sleep disruption or an altered level of daytime wakefulness occurs. paransomnias the most common are: sleepwalking, night terror or nightmares, sleep bruxism and nocturnal enuresis.

name: Excessive daytime spleepiness
medical_dictionary:
Drowsiness is a sleep disorder, an exaggerated attitude of this. You have a strong need for sleep or sleep for long periods (hypersomnia).
The patient sleeps during the day. Dozes when standing still, in public events, etc.

name: Varicone veins
medical_dictionary: Varicone veins

name: Cryptorchidism
medical_dictionary: Cryptorchidism or undescended testicles is a disorder that occurs in one or both testicles fail to descend into the scrotum. Orchidopexy or operation of cryptorchidism is surgery. It is a problem that affects 4% of newborns. During pregnancy one testicle, or the two, do not descend into the scrotum. S and occurs as a result of hormone deficiency HAM. Premature infants are more prone to this disease, although usually resolve when the baby is nine months old. It is not a serious problem but must be resolved by a simple operation called orchidopexy.

name: Yeast infections (Candidiasis)
medical_dictionary:
Thrush is an infection caused by the fungus Candida, the most common is Candida albicans. It is found in small amounts in the vagina, mouth, digestive tract and skin, often without causing infection. However, the amount of Candida albicans may increase leading to a yeast infection. Most women have a yeast infection throughout their lives.
The causes of candidiasis are:
-Be Taking antibiotics used to treat other types of infections.
-be Pregnant.
Ser obese.
-Having Diabetes.
- Thrush is not spread through sexual contact. But some men may have a rash on the penis after sexual contact.

name: Face Bioregeneration
medical_dictionary: Facial Bioregeneration

name: Pediatric Surgery
medical_dictionary: The pediatric surgery is a subspecialty of surgery that is based on the diagnosis and application of specific techniques according to the child's medical history.

name: Tumors of unknown origin
medical_dictionary: Tumors of unknown origin are those that are located in an organ but its features and appearance are typical of other undetermined different organ. Or exploration or laboratory testing, or radiogradías, or biopsy, allow to know and specify the origin of cancer.

name: Varicone veins surgery
medical_dictionary: Varices operation involves removal of varicose veins. These are swollen veins full of blood, which have pain and are usually found in the legs. If you have circulation problems, pain in the legs or simply want to improve the appearance of these you can consult the surgeon

name: Micrograft hair transplant
medical_dictionary: The hair transplant is a technique that allows facing the alopecia. It is a hair transplant from the patient that is done under local anesthesia, the root of the hair of a zone are implanted in areas where there is lack of hair.

name: Edema
medical_dictionary: The edema is swelling which is caused by the fluid in different body tissues. It most often occurs in the legs, feet and ankles but can affect the entire body.

name: Prostate biopsy
medical_dictionary: Prostate biopsy is a test that involves obtaining small samples of the prostate to see if this growth is benign or malignant. Thus, it is possible to determine and ascertain whether or not the patient has prostate cancer. During the process, the doctor inserts a needle through the wall of the rectum into the prostate. When removing the needle, a small cylinder of prostate tissue is removed. This action is repeated 8 to 18 times, although in general the most common is to be performed 12 times. To carry out the test, which lasts only 10 minutes, the patient will need to have taken antibiotics the days before and the day after surgery to prevent infection.

name: Short stature
medical_dictionary: Short stature or stature refers to children and adolescents who are below average height that corresponds to their age. Short stature is not necessarily a symptom of a health problem, it may be a delay in growth or slower than normal, or a parent who is of short stature.

name: Inflammatory bowel disease
medical_dictionary: Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) is used to refer to chronic diseases affecting the intestine, the most common are Crohn's disease (CD) and ulcerative colitis (UC).

name: Fertility Treatment
medical_dictionary: Fertility treatment is a technique used in osteopathy intended for those couples with problems having children. These treatments significantly increase the chances of pregnancy in families with serious problems. The head pressure in the abdominal area or in other parts of the body can be the trigger for a woman can not get pregnant. Working these increase the likelihood and can be the solution for many couples wanting to bring a child into the world.

name: Visceral Osteopathy
medical_dictionary: A proper functioning of the viscera depends on good physiological mobility and good vascularization. When this mobility is limited, it is due to the lack of veno-lymphatic drainage, which hinders the proper functioning of the viscera. By osteopathic treatment, we can secure a free path restriction of arteries, veins and nerves. Professional work is performed on the body, with a purpose to restore mobility and allow proper operation.

name: Tendinopathy
medical_dictionary: Tendonitis or tendinopathy responds to inflammation or swelling of the tendon, which is the structure that joins muscle to bone. Basically it has symptoms of pain in that joint, especially accentuated at night. name: Vestibular Tests
medical_dictionary: The vestibular tests are those studies conducted to examine the functionality of the inner ear responsible for balance:vestibule and semicircular canals. The ear is responsible for maintaining the look and posture through a vestibulo-oculomotor reflexes called and vestibulo-spinal. The review specifically the vestibular system is based on the study of a reflex phenomenon called nystagmus. This is an eye movement divided into two phases of different speeds:one fast and one slow, caused by the connections that link the brain with the vestibular system and the nuclei of eye movements. The aim of vestibular testing is to verify proper function of the organs of equilibrium ears if the patient suffers fainting. During the realization of these tests different stimuli applied to the inner ear, in which the temperature, also called caloric test is the most widely used are used. Other detection systems are tested for spontaneous eye movements, positional tests, visuo-oculomotor testing or rotational tests.

name: wrist fracture
medical_dictionary: The wrist fracture is common in young patients and in adults over 65 years. This type of failure occurs when the end of the radius, located right next to the wrist, is broken. In medical terms are often called distal radius fracture always occurs approximately one inch from the end of the bone and its causes may be different. One of the most common is the Colles fracture in which the broken fragment of the radius tilts up. There are also intra-articular fracture, which extends into the wrist;Extra-articular fracture, which does not extend inwards;open or open fracture when the fractured bone cross the skin and which must act quickly to prevent an infection; comminuted fracture where the bone is divided into more than two parts.

name: Posterior cruciate ligament
medical_dictionary: The posterior cruciate ligament connects the tibia and femur. Its function is to limit the play of the tibia relative to the femur, as well as limiting the tibial external rotation and along the anterior cruciate ligament, the forces applied to restrict the movement of the knee inward or outward, especially when important the knee is flexed. PCL injury may be caused by direct trauma to the front of the tibia that may occur, for example, in an accident in which the knee is bent and a strong impact causing it to bend backwards or is forcibly deformed. When the injury is caused by high-energy trauma, it relates to more serious injuries, fractures of long bones, pelvis or postero-external injuries or other complex structures. In most cases, partial immobilization support is applied for approximately 4 or 8 weeks and once this period is carried out rehabilitation.

name: Phlebology

This problem can also be caused by risk factors such as advanced age, postmenopausal osteoporosis, reduction of mass musuclar, suffering from diseases such as osteoporosis or cancer that weaken bones and, finally, the practice of contact sports such as football. The continuous effort to try to focus on objects up close, can cause symptoms such as eyestrain, itchy eyes and headaches. In patients with hyperopia, the image is viewed from behind the retina instead of directly on it, unlike what happens in an emmetropic patient without graduation. The hyperopic eye patient because it is shorter than usual, or because the optical power of the lens and / or your cornea is lower than normal.

name: hypothalamus
medical_dictionary: The hypothalamus is a small hormonal gland, the size of a pea, located in the center of the brain. Their task is to control and regulate each and every gland body functions, such as energy levels, sleep cycles, temperature, blood pressure, muscle function, immune system, among other functions. This gland depends on external factors and receives all information from every part of the body. Parallel changes and resets the functions of our body. Once filtered information, the hypothalamus sends orders to the body in two ways: the autonomous nervous system, through the spinal cord, the pituitary gland and, through the endocrine system.

name: Herpes zoster
medical_dictionary: Herpes zoster, also called shingles, is an infection caused by the reactivation of the chickenpox virus by different causes (stress, immune decline associated with other viral processes ...) infection and can occur in different parts of the body, most often in the back and abdomen. Once the chickenpox, the virus remains dormant in certain nerves. Have more risk of developing this condition the seniors, if before their first birthday contracted chickenpox and if your immune system is weak due to medication or disease. Generally, the first symptom is pain, tingling or severe burning, in a single band of the body, and is followed by a rash. Shingles can be solved with an antiviral and taking some care as applying cool, wet compresses to the skin to soothe pain and itching and bed rest, if you have a fever.

name: spider venis
medical_dictionary: Spider veins are a physical condition like varicose veins but smaller size. Its appearance is usually red or blue and similar to tree branches or spider webs color, hence its name. It manifests in the legs, facial areas such as the nose, cheekbones and other parts of the face and can appear in a small area or spread. It arises because of the weak or damaged valves of the veins. The factors favoring the appearance of spider veins are aging, medical history, birth with weak valves increases the risk; hormonal changes, pregnancy, obesity, lack of exercise or exposure to sor. Currently, the best treatment for removal is the laser.

name: Clinical Trials

To participate in any, in charge of clinical trials should study the anatomy and physiology of the person to know whether it is appropriate to submit the study. name: Pulmonary Nodule
medical_dictionary: The pulmonary nodule is a spot with round or oval shape that occurs in the lungs and is detected by a CT scan or a chest X-ray. In most cases, the appearance of the lung nodule is not cancerous. Among the causes of their appearance may be scars and past infections. Their morphology is small, with a smooth edge and solid appearance and uniform. In the case of malignant, lung cancer is one of the major diseases that develop. Normally, the pulmonary nodules usually have symptoms. If the patient is a smoker, have symptoms of lung cancer themselves or nodule has grown or changed in appearance, your specialist may want to do a biopsy to rule out cancer.

name: Hip replacement surgery
medical_dictionary:
It is surgery to replace all or part of the hip joint with an artificial joint, which is called a prosthesis. The hip joint consists of two main parts. One or both sides can be replaced during surgery:

  • The hip socket (part of the bone of the pelvis called the acetabulum)
  • The upper end of the femur (femoral head called)

The new hip to replace the old hip is composed of the following parts:

  • A drink, usually made of strong metal.
  • An insert, which fits into the cup or acetabulum, usually, is plastic, but some surgeons are now trying other materials like ceramic. The liner allows the hip to move smoothly.
  • A metal or ceramic ball that will replace the round head (top) of the femur.
  • A metal stem that is attached to the femur to give more stability to the joint.

name: Patella prosthesis surgery
medical_dictionary: Surgery in which the knee joint is replaced by an artificial joint. Cartilage and damaged bone are removed by general or regional anesthesia, then the prosthesis is placed. These prostheses can be made of metal and plastic parts, in some cases ceramic is also used.

name: digital dermoscopy
medical_dictionary: The digital dermoscopy is a technique of detecting skin CANDER. Besides being used in detecting malignancies of the skin, it is used for tracking mole on the skin surface. This technique involves making a digital photograph of the moon.

name: Cardiac Rehabilitation
medical_dictionary: Cardiac rehabilitation is a medical program for people suffering from heart problems. It aims to help people to have an active life and reduce the risk of other problems. It is intended for people who have suffered a stroke coración a anginoplastía, angina, heart failure, a repair or replacement of heart valves or heart transplant or lung.

name: Assisted reproduction
medical_dictionary: Form of reproduction in which offers medical care for contacting the egg and sperm; in humans it is used in cases that must be overcome any medical problem that prevents the couple achieve pregnancy.

name: psychosocial oncology
medical_dictionary: Psycho-oncology is a specialized between medicine and psychology that deals with the relationships between behavior, health status and disease prevention and treatment, the promotion of healthy habits and interdisciplinary branch. Oncological psychology is a branch in charge of studying psychology and psychotherapy of patients with cancer and their families, offering them the tools to cope with the diagnosis and treatment of any type of cancer. Through psychotherapy, the therapist guides and gives emotional support to patients at all stages of the disease, especially for adaptation to psychological and physical disorders that involve treatments and surgical operations (such as hair loss caused by chemotherapy, or breast removal in the case of breast cancer). Furthermore, in the event that the type of cancer or its late detection not allow a diagnosis nor a hopeful patient or curative treatment, oncological psychology is concerned with the support and guidance of the family throughout the process of illness and bereavement detecting own development processes such pathological reactions.

name: Eagle's syndrome
medical_dictionary:
All people possess a bone on each side of the base of the skull, tusk-shaped, up to each ear, about 4 or 5 cm deep. It is called styloid process and by style-hiodeo ligament joins the skull with her hyoid bone in the neck. When one or two ligaments ossify or calcify, occurs Eagle Syndrome. It is a rare disorder.

Patients presentarn a variable series of painful sensations in the throat, which define as intense and varied journey punctures localizazión. In addition, they may have ear pain, feeling of 'blocked', overproduction of Saluva, difficulty swallowing or speaking, limited neck movements, noise level of the mandibular season joint, sensation of a foreign body in the back mouth, forcing the patient to swallow frequently. dizziness or even temporary loss of consciousness. Sometimes it can be felt in the mouth abnormal oificación.

Suspecting Eagle syndrome, X-rays and a CAT scan especçificas be practiced.

name: Brain MRI
medical_dictionary: Brain MRI is a diagnostic test that is used to create images of the brain and surrounding nerve tissue.

name: Nanofat
medical_dictionary: The nanofat is a technique that is mainly used to remove dark circles. It separates the stromal stem cell-rich material, fat, by injection into the skin and allow a more effective and lasting results. This technique employs facial fat more than to display its wide range of benefits in terms of reduction of dark circles, improvement of face and neck wrinkles and skin regeneration.

name: Work accidents
medical_dictionary: The medical expert to determine the accidents suffered damage in the accident

name: Nasal septal perforations
medical_dictionary: The most frequent causes of septal perforation is previous nasal surgery (sequel) including surgery transnasal pituitary. Other causes are accidents, cocaine, clogging by nosebleeds, etc.

name: neonatal surgery
medical_dictionary: Neonatal surgery is one that is done in newborn babies up to 30 days.

name: Cryosurgery
medical_dictionary: Cryosurgery is a type of surgery that involves the application of nitrogen on broken skin in order to remove it. The duration of the procedure is short and effective, is performed on an outpatient basis and in most cases does not require anesthesia. It takes place in benign, premalignant lesions and some superficial malignant tumors and affects the lateral and depth of the lesion margins. Following the intervention, the specialist will recommend the application of an antiseptic and anti-inflammatory cream during the first days and a nourishing cream for the first month.

name: Down's Syndrome
medical_dictionary: People with this genetic disorder have 47 chromosomes instead of the 46 that would be the usual. Down syndrome is a genetic disorder that is caused by the additional presence of chromosome 21, which causes problems in the development of body and brain. People with Down syndrome have a common appearance characterized by a smaller-than-normal head, mouth and small ears, short and broad hands with short fingers, etc. Also, patients with the disorder suffers from social and mental retardation lower, for example, a slow learning process, impulsive and childlike behavior, and attention span and slow concentration.

name: CT urography
medical_dictionary: The CT urography or CT urography, is a radiology technique that is used to evaluate patients with blood in urine.

name: Virtual colonoscopy
medical_dictionary: Virtual colonoscopy is a different test of conventional colonoscopy. It is used for the detection of cancer colón.Consiste extract three-dimensional pictures of the colon.

name: CT scan
medical_dictionary: A CT scan is a test that is done to create images of the head.

name: Column MRI
medical_dictionary: Column MRI is a diagnostic technique of the area of ​​the spine.

name: Spondylolisthesis
medical_dictionary: Spondylolisthesis is a condition that affects the vertebrae of the spine causing a shift out. In children commonly it occurs between the fifth bone in the lower back and the first bone of the pelvis and can be a congenital malformation or sudden acute trauma injury. Other causes that can develop spondylolisthesis are osteopathy and consequently fractures certain sports such as gymnastics and weightlifting where great stress on the bones of the lumbar region is concentrated. For diagnosis the doctor will examine the spine and feel, besides raising the stretched leg in front of you, which you might find uncomfortable or painful. The treatment will be based on the severity of the displacement of the vertebra.

name: Preimplantation Genetic Diagnosis
medical_dictionary: Preimplantation genetic diagnosis is a technique used in IVF treatments for selecting embryos to avoid genetic and chromosomal diseases. Under Spanish law, this technique is authorized for the detection of serious hereditary diseases, early onset and for which there is still no cure. In these cases, preimplantation diagnosis can select from eggs fertilized embryo gene that free of the disease before being transferred to the uterus. The diagnosis is made based on the analysis of single cell embryo to determine whether or not carrying a particular gene mutation, and select or dismiss it for implantation. Thus, it improves the chances of success of IVF treatments and the risk of abortion is reduced.

name: Lynch syndrome
medical_dictionary: Lynch syndrome or cancer colorectal hereditary non-polyposis is a hereditary condition that increases the likelihood of developing colon and rectal cancer. There are two types of síndromde Lynch, type 1 affecting the colon and rectum cancer and type 2 involving other cancers as tumors in the ovary, pancreas or brain.
The sleeve gastrectomy is a surgical technique in bariatric surgery for obesity.
Liver cancer or hepatocellular carcinoma is a type of liver cancer. It is the main type of cancer within the primary malignant liver tumors. Generally it affects men more than women.

name: Ventricular tachycardia
medical_dictionary: Ventricular tachycardia is a rapid heartbeat. It takes place in the lower chambers of the heart, the ventricles.

name: Supraventricular tachycardia
medical_dictionary: Supraventricular tachycardia is a heart rhythm disorder. It is characterized by a rapid heart rate that occurs in the AV node.

name: peritoneal carcinomatosis
medical_dictionary: Peritoneal carcinomatosis is a form of intra-abdominal spread, through the peritoneum of gastrointestinal and gynecological malignancies and sarcomas of abdominopelvic with or without evidence of metastasis. There is a great individual variation in the extent of peritoneal carcinomatosis from small superficial lymph near the primary tumor up to full occupancy of the abdominal cavity by large invasive tumor deposits.

name: Work Stress
medical_dictionary: Job stress is the reaction or response of an individual to situations that occur concern and nervousness at work. The main symptoms that can develop job stress are divided into two groups: cognitive subjective, physiological and motor or observable level. In the first group are the fear, insecurity, difficulty deciding, fear, negative thoughts about oneself and the second sweating, musuclar pressure, palpitations, stomach discomfort, etc. Finally, motor level is to avoid feared situations, smoking, eating or drinking, motor restlessness as repetitive movements like scratching, tratamudear, mourn, etc. Among the solutions to avoid and prevent stress are maintaining a balanced diet, exercise and a good rest.
Marrow transplant, or bone marrow transplantation, is to replace the damaged bone marrow by cancer cells. These damaged cells are replaced by healthy stem cells.

name: immunofluorescence
medical_dictionary: Immunofluorescence is a laboratory test that diagnoses possible autoimmune diseases. Through substances become fluorescent antibodies and can be found bacteria or antibodies in biological samples.

name: Fetal Alcohol Syndrome
medical_dictionary: Children born to women who consume alcohol during pregnancy have Fetal Alcohol Syndrome. This damage mostly occurs later intellectual development. Alcohol also alters the function of the placenta, decreasing the oxygen transfer and various essential nutrients ,.

name: Mitral insufficiency
medical_dictionary: Mitral regurgitation is a disorder of the heart's mitral valve. It is characterized by reflux of blood from the left ventricle into the left atrium during systole. The mitral regurgitation surgery aims to repair the mitral valve.

name: Otoneurology
medical_dictionary: Otology is a subspecialty of Otology that studies and treats diseases of the inner ear and the nerves that run through the ear and its vicinity. These are the facial nerves, auditory, vestibular, halibut, vague and cord.

name: PET (tositron emission tomography)
medical_dictionary: PET tomography is a diagnostic test images. A team of special X-rays to create cross-sectional images of the body. The patient remains off during the scan and usually receive a contrast dye to better see some body parts

name: Endometrial cancer
medical_dictionary:
Endometrial cancer is the most common within the different types of uterine cancer. Currently, the exact cause is not known but may be related to increased levels of estrogen. It is given type of cancer among women in their 60s and 70s, still very rare in less than 40.

The symptoms presented endometrial cancer are abnormal vaginal bleeding after menopause, low abdominal pain or cramping in the pelvis and white vaginal discharge.

name: Vulvar cancer
medical_dictionary:
Vulvar cancer is generated in the external genitalia of women, usually affects the lips and folds of skin outside the vagina. It can also form, although less frequent, the clitoris or the vaginal opening.

Vulvar cancer is rare. Among the risk factors are infection human papillomavirus, smoking or a history of cervical cancer.

Women who have this cancer have symptoms such as itching around the vagina for years.

name: Ovarian cancer
medical_dictionary:
Ovarian cancer is generated in the female reproductive organs, is the fifth most common among women. Among the risk factors are:

  • Have fewer children and late pregnancies
  • Having had breast cancer or a family history of cancer

The symptoms are often mistaken for other ailments to be very common: abdominal bloating, feeling full quickly, abdominal pain, etc.

name: Lack of appetite
medical_dictionary:
Lack of appetite is a situation that occurs when the desire to eat is reduced. Any disease may have resulted in a loss of appetite but this should return when the condition disappears.

Sometimes, sadness or different emotions also lead to loss of appetite. Pancreatic cancer and colon, ovarian, stomach or.

name: Psychiatry elder
medical_dictionary: Psychiatry of the elderly

name: High cholesterol
medical_dictionary:
Dyslipidemia or high cholesterol is the high presence of blood fats. This can be caused by excessive consumption of fat or perhaps a change in metabolism. To diagnose dyslipidemia just a blood test.

Treatment of dyslipidemia is to follow a balanced diet, exercise and drug treatment.

name: Nipple reconstruction
medical_dictionary: In cases of breast cancer in which the areola is removed or have scars, their appearance can be recovered through micropigmentation. The aim of this is to conceal the scars of the operation of the pigmented areola affected even rebuild completely recreating the anatomy of the nipple.

name: Capillary micropigmentation
medical_dictionary: Capillary micropigmentation naturally recreates the presence of hair. The aim is to define hair by hair the lack of hair, alopecia, baldness, etc.

name: Myofascial pain
medical_dictionary:
Myofascial pain occurs in muscles, mainly on the back, neck and shoulders. They are caused by poor posture, tension in soft tissues, arthritis and other diseases or conditions.
Myofascial pain has a firm knot or band within the affected muscle.

name: Fetal echocardiography
medical_dictionary: Fetal echocardiography is a procedure similar to a pregnancy ultrasound, which through an ultrasound evaluates and detect possible changes in the baby's heart. It is usually performed between 18 and 24 weeks gestation and can be performed in the abdomen (abdominal ultrasound) or through the vagina (transvaginal ultrasound). The reasons why this method is performed may be different and can be distinguished: the blood flow, heart rate structures or baby. Through fetal ultrasound you can see a more detailed image of the heart baby in a normal pregnancy ultrasound. Some heart defects such as small holes in the heart or mild valve problems can not be detected, despite its high accuracy.

name: Septorhinoplasty
medical_dictionary: The septorhinoplasty, also known as rhinoseptoplasty, is a type of surgery that aims to correct together form and function of the nose. In a single surgical intervention to repair the external shape of the nasal pyramid and remodeling inside the nostril it is performed. It involves making incisions inside the nose. The surgery is performed under general anesthesia. After surgery, a small splint is placed on the back of the nose and nasal packing is maintained for a period of time is performed.

name: Osteosynthesis
medical_dictionary: Osteosynthesis is a type of operation in which several bone fractures implementing plates or pins, and other devices are attached.

name: Treatment of peri
medical_dictionary: Treatment of peri

name: Vertigo
medical_dictionary: The Vertigo is a feeling of imbalance arising from the structures of balance located in the inner ear (vestibular system) or connections of the structures of balance in the brain. When a sudden movement or a rapid change of the position of the head occur, can result in such connections balance problems, but do not usually last long. Among the symptoms they produce vertigo, the most common is dizziness. Anyway, dizziness can also be caused by diseases or disorders such as arrhythmia, insufficient production of blood in the heart, or the decrease in blood volume causes an inadequate flow of blood to the heart muscle.

name: Penile Prosthesis
medical_dictionary: A prosthesis is specially designed to replace a body part either missing or to make it work better device. In the case of penile prosthesis it serves to hold this body straightening and also helps them erections last longer. When other medical treatments for impotence have not proved satisfactory and comfortable, the penile prosthesis is often a good choice. There are two main groups: the flexible and inflatable. The first, of silicone or polyurethane, are introduced into number two within the corpora cavernosa of the penis, allowing an erection firm enough for penetration to occur. The size of the prosthesis fits the penis, and all parts are invisible as are inserted under the skin. Such air or hydraulic work by a similar mechanism that occurs during erection and allow natural sagging state. The choice of one type or another depending on the type of patient.

name: Septoplasty
medical_dictionary: Functional surgery of the nose is the intervention that seeks to correct any anomalies that hinder respiratory function, ie disorders that prevent enough air to reach the lower airways.

name: Allergic dermatitis
medical_dictionary: Atopic dermatitis is a skin disease that appears mostly in people suffering from allergies or with family members who suffer from them. It has no relationship with dermatitis but a relationship has been found between its appearance and the intake of certain foods, such as eggs, cow's milk or corn. It usually appears during the first months of life and is often manifested in the form of redness or crust on the skin of the baby, with itching (intense itching) in some very specific parts: face, scalp, hands, diaper area, legs and feet, and in folds of elbows and knees. People suffering from this disease can develop cataracts in adulthood, as well as episodes of herpes repeatedly, so it is important to establish the correct diagnosis, performing skin tests to establish the external agent that causes allergic dementia, and establish a series of habits to avoid the itching that is suffered in a generalized way in these cases. The treatment is based on addressing the allergy caused by this disease, the use of creams that alleviate the symptoms described above, and the use of corticosteroids in the most critical phases.

name: orthopedic surgery
medical_dictionary: This branch of surgery serves muscular disorders, bone and joint system, and also the ligaments and tendons, and their injuries, which can be of different nature. Applies to medical and surgical pathologies muscoesquelético correct device methods.

name: Peyronie
medical_dictionary: Peyronie's disease (also known as Peyronie syndrome) occurs when the area of ​​fibrosis (scar) in the corpus cavernosum penis is formed. That area loses elasticity, and not stretch when the corpora cavernosa to fill in the erection, the penis is bent toward the scar. This curvature can become painful and even prevent intercourse. Although the average age of men affected is 50, also it occurs in young people. The exact cause of this disease is unknown, but can result from trauma when the penis is erect, such as during intercourse. Studies have linked the syndrome of Peyronie with an impaired immune system of man. In an initial phase, the treatment consists of drugs, but if the disease progresses and continues bowing of the penis, surgery may be necessary.

name: Atopic dermatitis
medical_dictionary: Atopic dermatitis is a skin disease, sometimes chronic. Atopic skin shows inflammation and redness continue, is more sensitive because it lacks certain proteins. Atopic dermatitis is more common in babies, may appear within 2 to 6 months of age. Many people overcome over the years.

name: seborrheic dermatitis
medical_dictionary:
Seborrheic dermatitis is a skin disease. This has white or yellowish scales in areas more body fat as the face, scalp or inside the ear. If seborrheic dermatitis affects infants is called cradle cap.

Currently, not the cause of seborrheic dermatitis is known. It seems to be hereditary but can also be caused by hormone levels, weak immune system, lack of nutrients or that the origin of the scales is a fungus called Malassezia.

name: thoracic sympathectomy
medical_dictionary: The thoracic sympathectomy is the surgery that treats excessive sweating (hyperhidrosis ) or flushing. This operation is sweating on the palms of the hands or face. With the intervention these nerves to the body part cut sweat a lot.

name: Skin fungus
medical_dictionary: The skin fungus produce infectious diseases denomindas cutaneous mycoses. Symptoms include redness, itching and burning in the affected area. Two types of fungi, yeast or yeast that cause candidiasis and type of mold and dermatophytes which cause ringworm or tinea.

name: warts
medical_dictionary:
Warts are small skin lesions, growths, usually painless, and are harmless. There are many types of warts:

  • Common warts usually appear on the hands and are common in children.
  • Genital warts or warts appear on the genitals and around. They are caused by the human papilloma virus and you need to see a doctor.
  • Plantar warts appear on the soles of the feet and can be very painful.
  • There are also subungual and periungual warts that are below or around the fingernails or toenails.

name: anorectal manometry
medical_dictionary: The anorectal manometry is a test that analyzes the function of the anus and rectum. It is done especially in cases of constipation, anal incontinence or discomfort in the area of ​​unknown origin.

name: Low back pain
medical_dictionary: Low back pain or lumbago is pain in the bottom of the column. Low back pain is not a disease itself, but rather is a problem or a symptom whose causes can be multiple. The origin of this pain can be in bad posture, physical activity of the individual, psychological factors or degenerative diseases (such as osteoarthritis and osteoporosis) caused changes in the different structures that form the backbone (ligaments, muscles, spinal discs and vertebrae). Lumbago treatment involves the administration of analgesics, muscle relaxants and applying heat to the painful area. Also, the patient should rest.

name: Food Intolerance Test
medical_dictionary: There are food additives and preservatives that produce adverse reactions in our immune system, causing a series of more or less severe organic manifestations, which may even endanger the patient's health. Normally intolerances tend to produce delayed food intake, gastrointestinal symptoms reactions. When it is suspected that the body can not tolerate certain foods or substances it is advisable to undergo a food intolerance test, a test that evaluates and determines which foods cause problems or adverse reactions in the body. Currently, there are two types of test to detect the level of food intolerance: the Alcat food intolerance test and test Alpha 200, both are blood tests but in no case be reliable evidence in determining the underlying problem .
