name: Insect bites allergy
medical_dictionary: In the summer months are common insect bites and possible allergies they may cause, so it is advisable not to wear brightly colored clothing or strong fragrances to call your attention powerfully. Allergies to insect bites occur more specifically by the venom allergy some of these insects, especially allergies to the venom of wasps and bees. Wasps are usually very aggressive and can remove the sting of the skin where the bite occurred to recover, however bees leave him stuck in the skin, where the venom sac begins a rhythmic contraction which pumps the affected. These bites can be very annoying, according to the area and sensitivity of the individual, and in some cases may be even deadly. The most common symptoms that occur after an insect bite are inflammation and pain in the affected area for more than one day, urticaria, drowning, voltage sags, and instability symptoms that can lead to a anaphylactic reaction that must be addressed urgently. The cleanliness of the area and the local cold decrease the swelling but it is important to draw the sting of the skin should be present and go to an emergency room to receive the proper treatment.

name: Instability and falls
medical_dictionary: The unsteady gait and falls is considered the Great Syndrome Geriatrics generating frequent problems in the care of the elderly. International statistics show that about one third of people aged 65 and over living at home suffer a fall each year and, of these, about one in forty enter a hospital.

name: Dust mites, pollen, fungi allergy
medical_dictionary: Allergies are one of the most common diseases in today's society, consisting of the reaction of the immune system to certain substances or elements of nature. The most common allergies are usually mites, pollen and fungi, although some more. Allergy to dust mites is one of the most difficult to treat because the mites are always present in our daily lives, especially in domestic dust, and settle in many places ( carpets, soft toys, mattresses&hellip ;), causing a series respiratory distress ( rhinitis and asthma ) and conjunctivitis. To mitigate the effects of dust allergy you should avoid moisture and ventilate rooms, also clean the vents, filters heating and air conditioning. In regard to pollen allergy is a seasonal type, unlike the previous ones that can manifest steadily, and is caused by the pollen of grasses, trees and weeds. Furthermore, allergy to fungi also has an environmental component as present in the water stains on buildings, rotten food or animal cages and terrariums. Symptoms of these types of allergies can be reduced by the administration of antihistamines, nasal decongestants and, if required, allergy shots (immunotherapy ).

name: Occupational Allergy
medical_dictionary: Occupational Allergy

name: Pulmonary Function Tests
medical_dictionary: Spirometry is a technique or perform simple, painless test that measures the capacity of our lungs take in and release air. Used to diagnose some of the more common obstructive lung disease (asthma, cystic fibrosis ...), or other breathing difficulties expressed by some patients and for which the cause is unknown. Furthermore, it is also used to evaluate whether exposure to allergens causes some damage to our respiratory system, in cases of patients with allergies. For its realization a spirometer is used and there are two levels or types of respiratory function tests: the first, the patient should inspire everything you can and quickly and then expel all the air in the time you need; The second way to do this test requires the patient to perform a slow but continuous inspiration and after a quick and forced expiration, allowing expel all the air in your lungs.

name: Liposculpture
medical_dictionary: Liposescultura manual is a technique that is carried out from our hands, and applied to the fatty tissue of the skin to remove fat cells and fat descompensar volumes.

name: Diagnosis of lung nodule
medical_dictionary: Lung nodules usually do not cause pain or other symptoms and is diagnosed by X-ray in the chest. However, when it comes to cancer or benign nodules we can not ensure with all the firmness that are based on these diagnoses.

name: Allergy provocation test
medical_dictionary: Allergy tests are that set of tests are performed to a patient in order to establish the substance or allergen to which manifests a pathological reaction. There are three types of tests: the prick test the skin, intradermal skin test and patch test. In the first, also called prick test, a small amount of the substance being studied under the skin surface of the patient's forearm and observed 15-20 minutes if there was redness or swelling of the skin is punctured. The intradermal skin test is used to detect more specific allergies such as insects and is based on injection of allergen into the skin. Finally, the patch test allergens are applied in a tape adhered to the patient's skin for 48 hours you will see his reaction after 72-96 hours. During these tests can feel some of the discomfort of allergy, such as itching, nasal congestion, watery eyes, or skin rash if you are allergic to the substance with which he has contacted.

name: Food Test
medical_dictionary: There are food additives and preservatives that produce adverse reactions in our immune system, causing a series of more or less severe organic manifestations, which may even endanger the patient's health. When it is suspected that this happens to eat a particular food or group of foods is advisable to undergo a food intolerance test, a test that evaluates and determines which foods cause problems or adverse reactions in the body. Currently, there are two types of food test to detect the level of intolerance to certain foods: Alcat test and test Alpha 200, both are blood tests but in no case to be reliable when it comes to determining the underlying problem tests. In addition, the public health system are not covered yet and are proof of true economic cost.

name: Gold threads
medical_dictionary: The gold thread is a technique that aims to correct and prevent the effects of aging on the skin of the face and I strain. The technique, known as Remaillage offers very similar to the lifting results through less invasive intervention. The face fabric with gold thread combat sagging and aging of the face and neck to promote collagen formation, increased reticulin fibers and increased vascularization in the implant.

name: Coronary artery bypass
medical_dictionary: Coronary artery bypass surgery is a surgical technique used to restore blood flow that supplies the heart. There are two types: with ECC and off-pump CABG. When surgery is performed with the second technique, a portion of the bypass or graft (piece of artery or healthy vein extracting surgeon elsewhere in the body) is connected, around the area of ​​blockage in the artery, restoring the flow blood. This operation prevents bypass the patient has side effects and improve its recovery. In the case of using cardiopulmonary bypass, surgery is required to stop the heart while a machine is responsible for assuming his role and that of the lungs.

name: Implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD)
medical_dictionary: An implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD), or internal defibrillator is a device through which is circulated a sharp and high-voltage electric current to stop and reverse arrhythmias. It is indicated in cases of cardiorespiratory stops and in which the heart beats out of control and very quick. Under these conditions, the heart muscle is unable to pump blood into the bloodstream, so it is necessary to stop and control this arrhythmia. ICD implantation to an electrode through veins and placed under the skin generator is implanted. With the emergence of rapid arrhythmia, implantable defibrillator detects and automatically emits a loud and sudden shock, enough to send arrhythmia and heart rate returns to normal power.

name: Stent (cardiac, coronary, aorta)
medical_dictionary: A stent is a tube-shaped device that is placed inside blood vessels in order to get strengthen and keep open the concrete wall of glass that is damaged or required. A stent (cardiac, coronary or aorta) has a composition and mesh-like plastic or metal look: a coronary stent or cardiac stent is the one that is placed into an artery after performing balloon angioplasty to prevent conclusion thereof; aortic stents are used to treat aneurysms or aortic dilation. To place an operation in which a flexible tube is inserted through a small incision in the groin, advancing it through the femoral artery into the aorta, and then to the aneurysm where the stent is placed is performed.

name: Cancer Pain
medical_dictionary: A cancer patient may experience pain because the tumor or metastasis is damaging or pressing organs or body structures where they are located, such as nerves, muscles, blood vessels, bones, etc. Usually, cancer pain is classified into three types: somatic, visceral or nerviopático, according to the structure or body that is damaged. Somatic pain is pain experienced in the skin, muscles and bones; visceral occur in the viscera, such as intestines, pancreas, liver, etc; and neuropathic pain affects the nervous system. In the event that a cancer patient will experience back pain may be due to the tumor is pressing some part of the structure thereof.

name: Lung tumors
medical_dictionary: A lung tumor is formed by a mass of cells and rapidly growing abnormally and multiply within the lung. Always they diagnosed through a chest radiograph and can cause scarring, inflammation, infection or other more serious diseases such as lung cancer. There are two types of tumors: benign, formed by cells very similar to normal and remain in their primary site; and evil, which are uncommon compared with malignant lesions, which are characterized by invasive, serious and metastasize (spread to other areas). To rule out the possibility that the tumor is malignant be made, other than chest radiography, chest tomography and biopsy. The most common benign tumors include bronchial adenomas, hamartomas (90%) and papillomas. All these benign manifestations are operated for surgical removal.

Throughout the sessions, supported by the psychotherapist and the other members of the group, each patient will express your emotions and learning to listen and understand those of others, facilitating the resolution of your personal process improvement. As individual psychotherapy, group therapy is effective in treating problems like depression, anxiety, the impact of chronic or severe illness, the difficulty relating ...

name: Thoracentesis
medical_dictionary: Thoracentesis is a proof point of the chest wall puncture to extract liquid and / or air in the pleural space (external space of the lungs) using a thin hollow needle or a catheter. Normally the test is performed with the aim of analyzing a sample of fluid causing excessive pleural effusions, but also other causes such as lung cancer, pulmonary embolism, pneumonia, pancreatitis, etc. Thoracentesis no prior preparation is required, but the realization of a chest radiograph before and after the test. Besides, it is necessary that the patient does not cough or move during the process as this could cause damage to the lung. The test starts with the application of anesthesia in the back area where the pleural puncture takes place, which involves inserting the needle above the rib into the pleural space to remove a sample of the liquid to be analyzed in the laboratory. As the result, the treatment will be adapted to the pathology.

name: Painful Elbow
medical_dictionary: The term encompasses all painful elbow problems that may affect the elbow joint. The cause most often causes pain in this area is tendinitis, or inflammation of the tendons. In this sense, the players tend to injure the tendons on the outside of the elbow, a condition called epicondylitis or tennis elbow. That injury also suffer the people who make repeated movements, especially of rotation of the forearm or wrist extension. Other causes of elbow pain may be bursitis, arthritis, muscle strain or infection. The painful elbow can also occur as a result of a problem in the spine. Therefore, treatment depends on the cause and type of injury.

name: Painful foot
medical_dictionary: The term encompasses all painful foot problems that can cause pain in any part of the foot (heel, arch, instep, plant or fingers). The foot pain can be caused by a condition only developed locally, for example, plantar fasciitis caused so much pain in the foot as pain in the heel. Other injuries also generate pain in the area are bunions, metatarsalgia, ram, flat feet or tripe. Also, the painful foot can be another sign of other diseases such as diabetes, rheumatoid arthritis, vasculitis, gout or neurological diseases. Treatment depends on the cause and type of injury caused but can include everything from physiotherapy to orthopedic footwear or foot surgery in severe cases.

name: Testicular Cancer
medical_dictionary: Testicular cancer develops in one or both testicles, the male reproductive tract, but can also originate in the abdomen or chest. This is one of the most common malignancy among young men and has one of the highest cure rates of all cancers, reached 90% of improvement. This cancer can develop from any cell of the testes, although more than 95% of testicular cancers are germ cells. Germ cell tumors are divided into seminomas and noseminomas, being the second largest spread than the first. The most recommended treatments, depending on the degree of tumor are surgery, radiotherapy and chemotherapy.

name: Colon and rectum cancer
medical_dictionary: Colon cancer is the proliferation of malignant cells in the colon, which, along with the rectum, is in charge of storing faeces which are then expelled through the anus. That is why this is a very favorable area for the development of a cancer, since accumulated waste substances. Also, its causes are also determined by genetics, sedentary lifestyle and previous illnesses, such as polyps, ulcerative colitis and other cancers. The most obvious symptoms of the disease begin to make visible when the disease is advanced: alternating between diarrhea and constipation, blood in the stool, abdominal pain, loss of appetite, weight loss and fatigue. If detected early has a good chance of healing, and its most common treatments radiotherapy, chemotherapy, immunotherapy to strengthen the body's defenses, and surgery. By the operation of the affected colon cancer if you are well localized part is removed.

The cause of this disease occurs when plaque remains in the artery wall, blocking the passage of arteries to carry blood to the arms and legs. There is no clear cause of plaque buildup, but there are some conditions that increase the risk to suffer. Smokers or former smokers, as well as diabetics, those with a blood pressure or high cholesterol.

Failure to address these episodes can lead to having to amputate the foot or leg.

medical_dictionary: Fractionation is a laser, fast and relatively free noninvasive pain that can eliminate inconvenience of daily medication. Moreover, it often works when traditional acne treatments have not worked. Laser treatment, unlike other methods to treat severe acne, is a noninvasive procedure, without serious side effects or high risk.

name: Panic
medical_dictionary: A panic attack occurs when anxiety reaches a level of intensity or duration so high that comes to terrorize the individual. Although its main cause is anxiety, genetic predisposition and consumption of certain substances also they influence. The symptoms, which manifest abruptly, are palpitations, sweating, breathlessness and chest tightness.

name: Botulinum toxin (botox)
medical_dictionary: Botulinum toxin (Botox) is a drug that is injected in minute quantities at strategic points on the face to try and minimize the furrows and wrinkles. Botox works by slowing the contraction of facial muscles temporarily, leaving the skin smooth and toned, and correcting wrinkles and preventing its progression. The effects of the injection are not immediate, depending on the patient begin to reveal after three or four days, but the results are highly satisfactory. Furthermore, according to the patient the effect of botulinum toxin can last between 4 and 8 months, so to keep treatments are to be undertaken reminder. Apart from its aesthetic utilities, Botox also has other medical applications such as the correction of excessive sweating, or treatment of tics and spasms.
